Reviews.Title: “How did this hotel get given 4**** rating?”
Reviews.Author: Neligan-D
Reviews.Content: I took the wife away for a surprise birthday trip to Rome. This hotel came up at a good price and in a good location so I jumped at it. We stayed between 26-31 march, and changed rooms immediately to a marginally better room. Ok..let's do positives. Location is great literally is less than 10 minutes walk from the colleseum, roman forum and many other sites. Also very near to the train/metro/bus station for ease of travelling around the city. The view from the 7th floor at breakfast was brilliant. Also the bed was actually surprisingly comfortable. Negatives... The room was very basic and in need of some serious upgrading. The walls were covered in scuff marks giving it a dirty feel to the room, the bathroom also felt dirty..the shower head needed to be cleaned by me before we could use it. This was after moving rooms because the first was even dirtier. Tv in room had a poor signal also..but thats just being picky as we didn't go to Rome to watch te tv. The lift had mind of its own..didn't like stopping on our floor as the doors didn't open and had to wait 5 minutes before it worked out that we did want to get out!! Overall, disappointing hotel. Was comfortable but not luxurious enough to be considered 4* in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian B
Reviews.Content: It markets itself as a 4star hotel, when I visited in March 2012 at least 2 of the stars had failed to make an appearance. Rooms small badly in need of refurb, the door to the ensuite had been kicked in previously leaving a hole, the shower has a curtain across it that attacks you when in.Breakfast was poor , where was the fresh fruit? Generally the whole place needs redecorating or at least permanently removing 2 of the stars so as not to be misleading.Almost forgot the temp was 21 C, but the aircon was not working so had to sleep withthe window open. The location is on a very busy street so the noise was awful and this is in the off season.You have been advised.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better!!”
Reviews.Author: Robin C
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist and given a room key and told where to find the room. When we got in the room we didn't even bother to unpack, the room was small and the facilities were in what only can be described as a "Tunnel" a very narrow corridor with a shower at one end a Bidet and toilet at the other. We were traveling with friends and their room was the same sort of box room too. After complaning we were both given new rooms which were quite spacious amd comfortable. The decor was a bit tired throughout the hotel and a refurb was overdue. The hot water seemed to run out in the morning so if tou're a late riser you'll have a warm shower, plenty of hot water in the evening tho. Plus side to the hotel was very friendly and helpful staff near to the Terminous and the breakfast was continental style and very nice and plenty of it. On arrival at the airport there were plenty of buses to whisk you into the heart of Rome for only 4 to 6 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Book other hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarlenkaZ
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews that other people had left i didnt think it will be as bad. The hotel is rated as a 4* and maybe it was a four star when it was first open but it hasnt been touched since. Our room had some kind of air conditioning but we were afraid to use it because the vents looked like they were never cleaned. We didnt have hot water for one whole day. The breakfast was very poor, bread rolls were not fresh. The olny good thing about this hotel is the location because it is only 5 min away from termini station. To be honest i didnt think that in a 4* hotel there could be no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - ideal for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: BarryMip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located only 2 mins from the main Termini Station and walking distance to the main tourist locations around Rome. The price was very competitive compared to other hotels and we had a really enjoyable stay here. The staff were very friendly and despite our attempts to speak Italian were very fluent and welcoming in speaking English. The room was just as expected from the photos online, very charming and ideal for a short stay in Rome. Unlike other travellers we don't spend our time taking endless pointless photos of the hotel acting like we are professional hotel critics. We went to Rome to visit the historic buildings and to experience the culture of Rome, and spent very little time in the hotel itself. The bed was extremely comfortable, in fact we over slept breakfast on the first day it was that comfy. Breakfast was continental and an ideal starter for the day with a good view over the city. The bathroom was clean and well maintained by the daily cleaner. There are plenty of restaurants nearby so dinner was not so far away on an evening. Overall a lovely quaint hotel perfectly suited for a short city break in Rome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: dapretty1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not 4* at all. If I had to compare it, it's on the same level as travelodge. It is clean but the room was tiny. I did not have breakfast or go to the breakfast room as the breakfast ended at 930am (too early for me to eat) however being on the 6th floor and what I would assume to be directly below the breakfast room, I could hear chairs moving and blenders going every morning. The hotel is located 2 mins from termini (if you take the exit facing McDonald's and go left then cross over at the pedestrian crossing by Coin and the Hotel is located at the second left turn) IF you are looking for something close to the station where you can get the train or bus directly to the airport or tour buses etc the location is excellent. I would not stay here again because it was not up to my standards but it was liveable. Also a few reviews said the area is dodgy at night, I was travelling alone and did not witness this. I thought the area was orally safe, I even went yet to dinner at 1030/11pm and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for What We Wanted for our Snowy Weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaZoe
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of reviews that had said that this was by no means a 4 star hotel.. Which I have to admit it wasn't. But at the same time this hotel was absolutely perfect for what we needed. We went on a weekend trip to Rome (Friday to Sunday), with a view of seeing all the sites & therefore never intended on spending much time in the hotel. It provided us with everything that we wanted - a comfy bed, a clean bathroom & breakfast in the morning before we went out. The rooms were very small, but came with a large wardrobe, a safe, a TV & a minibar. The bathroom was by far the best bit, it was large & very clean, with big fluffy white towels and a heated towel rack (which came in so much use as the weekend that we went just so happened to be the weekend that it poured with snow in Rome for the first time in 26 years..). The breakfast wasn't to my taste as I am not a fan of any continental breakfast to be honest but it had all the standard things & still had bits that I would eat & was enough to keep me going until lunch time. We didn't see much of the staff, but from what we did they all seemed very polite & friendly. When we requested an extra pillow & an extra blanket they were more than happy to help. One of the main points as to why I would recommend this hotel is for its location. It is within walking distance of a lot of the attractions, all except the Vatican which we took the Metro to & then walked back. It is right next to the Termi Station also, so even if you do not want to walk, you can easily get a bus, a train, a taxi or the metro to any location that you want. Also there are some fabulous restaurants nearby. If you read some of the other reviews, yes they will moan about the flakey paint around the hotel & the rickety old lift that can only hold 4 people at a time. But at the end of the day if you want a hotel that is relatively clean & comfy, in a very ideal location then I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a low budget vacation”
Reviews.Author: RIR_2011
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, cleanliness was average. Air conditioning didn't work properly. Breakfast was very poor. The hotel is close to the central station, central location, and good restaurants around, although quite shabby area during night.

Reviews.Title: “Champagne Palace”
Reviews.Author: Beneh
Reviews.Content: Well ....It was listed as a 4 stars hotel and i don't see why. That is a two stars hotel top. It clearly needs a fresh paint, it's old and in some parts dated and somehow dirty. The room was Ok, with a fridge, though noisy because mine was on the street. Bathroom was nice size and clean. Was on the second floor, my choice. There is a Tiny elevator... Breakfast was no thrill. But it is located close to the Termini station, which is very convenient. By the way Via Principe Amedeo as a lot of other hotels options.15 minutes walk to the Coliseum, Half one hour walk to Campo Fiori, 20 minutes train ride to the Vatican for example. Have plenty of little restaurants and shops around the hotel. Was traveling alone and as a female I thought it was OK in terms of security even though the train station is not super friendly at night. It is half an hour by express train from the airport which is great. And Mr Massimo at the front desk was indeed very very nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: paulandlauren11
Reviews.Content: We stopped of at Termini and was at the hotel within 10 minutes walk, perfect, Outside it looks dated and old, but as you walk up the marble stairs it is lovely. We was early but they didn't mind, gave us our keys, explained we're we were on the maps on the counter and answered any question we had giving directions to any place we chose. The room was quite small (hey were in rome, when qare we spending time in the room right?) but very clean, tv and a nice bathroom which was also very clean (something very important to us) a huge wardrobe and nice comfy bed. It was exceptional value for money. All staff night and day we're very helpful with any requests we had. We struggled making a booking in a restaurant and they booked the table and we had no problems whatsoever. The Restaraunt is on the 7th floor, no problem. lift heading up and down and the breakfast, although simple, i loved it, cheeses' ham, bread, coffee, orange juice. i would definately reccomend this hotel for the price. Not 4* but if your staying in your room in Rome, you should be asking yourself, why have you come to Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - if you set yourself for a 3*”
Reviews.Author: Frankie H
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's is lovely, rooms are smallish, but your in Rome! Lovely building and decoration and fanatastic location, very close to termini for bus to airport and other sites. The breakfast is not amazing and the shower was not very clean. Our safe did not work, but they sent someone up to try and fix it, when they couldn't they offered to put our stuff in the big safe downstairs and were very apologetic. Good service. Very comfortable bed and if you want a hotel just to sleep in, it is very satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as all that!”
Reviews.Author: teddymbear
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of the lastminute.com mystery hotel reviews I was very apprehensive about this hotel after having booked myself, my husband and our friends in for a 3 night mini break. Whilst i agree that this hotel is no longer of the 4* variety I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and tidy and had the facilities stated on the website and was serviced daily. The shower was a tad on the small side and there was some mould in one of the corners of the tray. The only real disappointments were that the bar and coffee lounge were not open during our stay and that there was a lot of road noise which if you're a light sleeper you would be better asking for a room on inside like our friends who had 512. they had no view and 509 was only a street view however they slept well! Breakfast each morning had choice of cereals, pastries , breads etc, again not 4* by UK standards. The staff at the hotel were very helpful. The location of the hotel was very close to the main train terminal and the trams. There was a small coffee shop opposite which was good.

Reviews.Title: “No Fizz at this Palace”
Reviews.Author: Trevor T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through 'lastminute.com' as a secret 4 star hotel for a 4 day break with my partner. On arrival at reception, it was quite clear that this 1 star hotel was masquerading as a 4 star hotel! Although the receptionist was polite and courteous on arrival, this cannot be said of the other staff who did not speak English and were uninterested in customer satisfaction. The room was small, dark and dirty, especially the carpet and shower room. The 25 year old tv only had about 3 channels available - Italian only! Breakfast was an interesting experience - limited buffet style food and the beverages were disgusting; again the staff were surly and unhelpful. Overall, a very poor hotel that requires a complete refurbishment, training of staff in customer services and a re-appraisal of it's star rating. Advice to anyone booking this hotel - DON'T!! Stay well clear of the 'secret hotel' booking through lastminute.com when looking to book a hotel in Rome, as you will probably get this one which you are unable to cancel.

Reviews.Title: “no bubbles in this champagne”
Reviews.Author: blonayBelfast
Reviews.Content: This is most certainly not a 4* star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. This is at most a 2* struggling out from 1*. The only plus to this hotel is the train station around the corner. The room had an unclean feel to it, the bathroom was dark and gloomy possibly to hide the deteriorating and mouldy corners in the extremely small shower. If you're carrying any weight or perhaps pregnant, you will not fit in! The cups at the bathroom sink are plastic and the complimentary shampoo etc are plastic sachets. There is no tea/coffee tray and the extremely small wardrobe had 3 hangers none of which would hold clothes of any weight. To be fair when we pointed out that we couldn't see anything in the room as so many light bulbs were out and the shutters on the window were firmly shut and would not open, the managment had rectified the problems later that day. Well, they replaced two of the bulbs and had eased the shutters out! The buffet breakfast is just ridiculous. You get to not only go fetch your meagre breadfast fare and take it to your plastic table, you also get to go find your cutlery,cups, plates etc. And you won't have to spend too much time choosing your breakfast. It is dismal pickings with undrinkable coffee from a machine, extremely suspect orange juice again from a machine which is a radioactive red and a choice of one type of cheese and two of ham which remained unchanged throughout our 4 day stay. The surly staff, particulary the older lady, thumped around the room with a plastic carton taking away the used plates etc. THIS IS NOT A 4* HOTEL and I would love to know how it gets away with declaring itself as such. Oh and although they agree to keep your cases on check out, there is no secure holding room or security system for retrieval. You are given a slip of paper to write your name on your cases which you are then directed to leave in an open plan room off reception... 4*????????

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars????? Yes ,30 years ago. Now only 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and untidy. Dust is in air. The staff were friendly (except one old lady, first you hear her , after you see), They don't know what that mean maintenance . You still can survives there, but please do not lie that is 4 Stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly not a 4****”
Reviews.Author: franidini
Reviews.Content: Ill maintain a very tired looking... cleanliness is low, dirty walls, hair in the bed sheets, cracks on the walls, flaky paint in the bathroom, toilette seat loose and lumpy hard bed. Central location but as it is close to the station it can quickly transform into a dodgy area at night. Staff in reception is friendly but can do with improving customer service for the breakfast team. Also a Tourism tax charge of €3 per night per person apply... first time I was asked money for it in an Italian hotel, and we travel into the country every few months!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: BritainCitygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my fiancé Nov 11. Booked through last minute secret rooms and got a really good deal. Hotel was tidy, clean and the location is absolutely spot on, really central and close to termi and metro which was great. Staff friendly and hotel has a slightly dated but old school glamour! Room was a fine size, breakfast room has a good view and breakfast was okay, though my fella did tire of ham and cheese and craved a bacon nutty :) Probably not a 4 * but definitely a good 3 and if all you want is somewhere to rest your head and enjoy beautiful Rome from, then this space is spit on! I'd certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Annemarie H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment based on our expectations from the photos on the hotel website. It's a 2* hotel at best. Bring your own hair dryer (the hotel's hair dryers are like hoover tubes) and your own sink plugs. Our room was small and had exposed electrical wires in several places, so definitely not safe for children.The shower was just sad. We booked as a Top Secret hotel on Lastminute.com; it was cheap but not really worth much more. If you want a relaxing hotel where you're not confined to your room, then book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolbellamy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with last minute secret hotel like most of the reviewers. We have complained to last minute having stayed there in early October but have recieved no response. This hotel is described as being a few minutes to the colloseum. It is in fact located in a grim area near termini station where you can a bus or train to the colloseum. My main complaint is the hotels reluctance to provide a spair toilet roll. My husband eventually had to find the cleaners to ask for one and was then followed down the corridor to see which room he was taking it to. If you have booked this secret hotel cancel now.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location.”
Reviews.Author: sally a
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Last Minute as a mystery hotel and tried to cancel after reading previous reviews of the hotel on this site. However I was glad that I was unable to. My daughter and I stayed for 3 nights. Our room was spacious and clean with comfortable beds. Breakfast was served on the 7th floor and included a range of hot drinks, croissants, cereals and rolls. Best of all the location was great for getting out and about in Rome. This isn't a four star hotel but it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Alayna_177
Reviews.Content: We originally were given a room where the door has clearly been broken into and wouldn't lock, we asked about cancelling our 3 night stay then were upgraded. The upgraded "Superior" room was average. Breakfast buffet was awful, never had hot water, they said their Wi Fi wouldn't be working for about a week and the t.v. only had about 3 channels. I wouldn't consider this hotel 4 stars by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Intel35
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a mystery hotel booking for four nights and got a very good rate by Rome standards. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small but in a city like Rome, we didn't want to spend much time in the hotel so it was more than big enough. The room and bathroom was cleaned on a regular basis. The main (very minor) gripes are: they only have Italian TV, and in a 4 star hotel some might expect at least limited English channels (for a city break, not a big issue for us); breakfast is a bit basic; the aircon is not great and if you are on a street side room you don't want to leave the window open; and the hallways and not carpeted, so when your idiot tourist neighbours come back late at night talking the noise echoes along the corridor and into your room (perhaps fellow travellers might be more considerate of other guests!). But overall, given the great price, the hotel is definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Sold as a 4 star, actually nearer 1 start”
Reviews.Author: yoda_ckte
Reviews.Content: Stayed at thsi hotel for four nights end of this October, booked as a mystery hotel through a website. Classified as a 4 Star but actually nearer a 1 star for the following reasons; no resturant, room service or even a bar. In fact, the only communal rooms were two small rooms off reception, one of which was used to store departing guests cases. Breakfast room on the roof was only open for breakfast (basic bread, cereals, cold meat and jams). The breakfast room roof leaked as well! Guest rooms were small with limited storage space (our case had to sit on the floor blocking the corridor to the on-suite. The air conditioning was non-existent (maybe switched off), so the room was very hot, even though October. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room in spite of the lack of room service. Fire doors wedged open with fire extinguishers day & night. Decor tired and grubby. TV old and very limited viewing. To be honest, when you read the specification for a 1 star, it didn't even qualify. The only plus point was the convenient location being a few minutes walk to the bus/train station.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: It is no where near a 4 star hotel to British standards. The room was basic and breakfast was fairly bad. The location is perfect and as we booked it as a mystery hotel it was very good value for money. I'd stay again for a budget site seeing holiday where all you want is a room to crash in, for a more luxurious stay look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: PadiP
Reviews.Content: This hotel suits anyone like us (a couple) or sports fans who simply need somewhere to crash after a hard day's sightseeing. No bath but good shower so long as you miss the evening rush. The area is a bit dodgy after dark as there are lots of people around it selling fake handbags, kebabs and themselves. That said they left us well alone and we found a lovely restaurant (Pastarito) just around the corner that served us great food and cheap wine. Breakfast was simple and filling but very samey after the fourth day! All in all a good, basic hotel but let down a little by the neighbours, as the roads are a bit noisy but well hidden behind the double glazing - and the air con is poor so avoid May to Sept. Great location to walk around the sights of Rome from.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Barry L
Reviews.Content: First, the positives being close to Termini it gave easy access to the whole of central Rome and the reception staff were helpful and pleasant but, in spite of the double glazing, it is noisy at night, the shower cubicle was dirty and on two mornings out of five there was no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but not for long term stays.”
Reviews.Author: Meregy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a stone's throw from termini station which made it ideal for my trip. I was staying over in Rome for one night to go cruising the following day. The hotel's proximity to the station allowed me to hop around the city and back with ease using the metro system. It is also very near to a number of nice (tourist targeted) restaurants offering tasty pizza and pasta at affordable prices. The hotels biggest downside was the air conditioning. Mu teip was at the end of July meaning temperatures were in the high twenties at night. The aircon couldn't handle this so I had to sleep with an open window which faced onto a busy and noisy road. Other than that the hotel is pleasnt enough. You pay more for location than luxury. I imagine it was a 4 star in its heyday but has dropped slightly by modern standards. Breakfast was provided in a lovely topfloor eatery with all the normal components of a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: anonymous12_11
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels. avg size, wonderful street view.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LittleBluey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel champagne Palace (sounds grand) for 5 days with my friend. I had been to Rome on other occasions but had never stayed with this hotel. I booked my stay through last minute and it was very cheap. On arrival we were greeted by a friendly man and were quickly delt with. Our room unfortunately was tiny, but I didn't have the best expectations for what I had paid. It was very clean and had a small tv with BBC news as English channel. I would have to say the overall highlight of our stay was the breckfast which was at the top of the building with a beautiful view of Rome! It was nice and airy up there which was refreshing, as the room was quite stuffy. The breckfast spread was continental with lovely lil home made cakes. The hotel is situated about a 15-20 min walk from centre, but there is an underground right up the road which is much better as it's only 2 euros to travel ANYWHERE in Rome (including beach 30 min away) and each ticket is valid for 90 mins as I remember. Great value! Would defo recommend that over taxis!! So all in all the hotel wasn't fabulas but well worth the cash if your looking for a short break to explore glorious Rome. More money for ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “Really close to train station and sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty1212
Reviews.Content: Close to train station.... a block or two. Good restaurants close and sightseeing all close too. Staff was very helpful. I lost one of my credit cards very early in our trip and they helped me make phone calls etc. Hairdryer could be better....lots of hotels have the same I found out. Breakfast was ok.... It was a cool old building!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel and Location for Rome”
Reviews.Author: TPGolfer
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a 'good rating' if possible. Overall, the stay was pleasant enough but the grumpy check-in service, small room, old tv, missing panel on shower cubicle (water leaked out although hanging a towel there limited the leakage), and broken door lock initially led to some apprehension about the place. Things did improve after that. The receptionist changed and this person was much nicer and more helpful. He helped us make a reservation for the Villa Borghese despite the Italian female cook complaining to him about something constantly (how did he do that?). The location is convenient as it is a block across from the main station, which was great when arriving from the airport and making an early day trip to Florence. Its also not too far to get to Central Rome and the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Friendly, and well located.”
Reviews.Author: travellinghist0rian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a city break in Rome. The staff were extremely friendly, the room was neat, clean, and very comfortable. The breakfast was ample and the breakfast room was bright and airy. Best of all the hotel was close to the metro/train/sightseeing, and convenient to a number of decent restaurants on a quiet street. This isn't the Ritz but it's great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break, great locations, great hotel for what we needed. X”
Reviews.Author: Katiewkd1
Reviews.Content: When I book this trip up, I used top secret hotel on last-min, when I look up the hotel and read all the reviews that people had said. I panicked. So I rang last-min.Com, and they reassured me. I started looking forward to my surprise trip for my boyfriend birthday pressi. When we arrived it was lovely and hot, and we had no probes finding the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised, the hotel was clean,cool and comfy. Just what we wanted, the location was fab 10 min walk to all the main sites, colosseum, travi fountain ect. If you going to spend time in the hotel, then I would look at a different break altogether. Rome, you dont have time to spend in the hotel. Get out and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - pay a little more and stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Danni C
Reviews.Content: Myself, partner and three of my family members have just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. We had three rooms and there was something wrong with all of them. I am well travelled and understand that a four star hotel in Europe is not a 4 star by UK standards. However, after staying at this hotel, I would suggest it would be better rated as a 2 star, 3 at a push. The air conditioning did not work in 2 of the 3 rooms and was blowing out hot air, for a 38 degree temperature outside, this was not appriciated! The corridor outside was cooler! There were no fans available. We went downstairs to talk to the receptionist who had a list as long as my arm with complaints from other guests.... Having no AC was one thing, however, not being able to have a shower due to no hot water/no water at all was a bitter disappointment, especially after walking around Rome all day in the sweltering heat. The rooms were a little small, but they were fine. If i was going back I would definitely pay a bit more to stay in a nicer hotel. No AC and no showers along with the stale food for breakfast - overall not a great stay....would definitely not recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Annika73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a weekend to celebrate a wedding anniversary in Rome. We found a very good deal online so the value was fine, but had I paid more I might have been disappointed (except with the location). Upon arrival we were planning to take the train to the termini station. However, when purchasing tickets we were offered a shuttle bus option that would take us all the way to the hotel for only 1 eur more per person than the train (thus 15 euros per person). We waited for 5-10 minutes max for them to fill up the shuttle bus and it turned out to be a very comfortable option - plus the sightseeing was very nice on the way to the hotel! The name of the shuttle bus company was italyrent and the driver was very helpful telling us about the sights that we passed. On our way back to the airport we took the train, the termini station is really about 100 m from the hotel (if you come out from the station and see a Mc Donalds, you can see the hotel sign a bit further down the next street on the left. The train was fine too, but do note that it's a long way to the platform from where you buy the tickets so don't leave it until the last minute. Upon arrival to the hotel before check-in time we were given our room. The tourist tax needs to be paid upon arrival even if you've paid the room beforehand (3eur/room/night). The room was quite small, but this is to be somewhat expected of downtown hotels in European capitals like Paris or Rome. It did have a certain charm, though, but it wasn't anything to write home about. The room showed wear but was clean and the airconditioning was fine. The pillows were very hard and the breakfast was a real disappointment, though. There were basic things like bread with jam or cheese/ham but nothing was really appetizing. There was no fruit! The hotel also didn't have an iron. There is a small grocery store between the termini and the hotel, we bought drinks and fruits that we stored in the minibar. A big grocery store with an excellent cheese selection (we bought loads to bring home as very cheap) can be found if you continue the same street past the hotel, 50 m and around the corner. The location was great for walking around the city and taking the bus and metro. On 2 evenings we took the bus to Trastevere where they had a festival by the river ( the Noantri had passed and we didn't catch the name of this one, but they said it would continue for all August) There were booths selling all kinds of things, bars and restaurants that were set up like at a festival. Great ambiance! The hotel was fine but next time I might pay a little extra to stay someplace a bit nicer when travelling as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Highest price per square foot of room we've ever paid, but still decent”
Reviews.Author: NorthArrow
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny--a king bed with about 1 1/2 foot of space on either side. But this is in central Rome so it was tolerable. The shower was fine, the AC adequate but barely so. Breakfast was basic--decent coffee that met our needs, and buns and some basic cold cuts and hard boiled eggs (no fruit). Still, we had not sought elegance (knowing European prices for such) and just wished something clean in a good locatation that had the basics covered, which this did. It's near the central train station, in walking distance of the Coleseum and other attractions, with several restaurant choices within a block. After we were there, just for the heck of it, we did some cost comparisons with other options within a block or so and could have done better on price and perhaps had free wireless use as well. This hotel had no wireless, free or otherwise. But there are internet services (1 Euro for 30 minutes) within a block or so.

Reviews.Title: “Over inflated prices - defintely not a 4* - against any country's standards!”
Reviews.Author: mcrobbiegt
Reviews.Content: Highly inflated prices - we stayed here for 2 nights through the "secret hotels" package. In quite a run-down part of rome (but it is near the station) and 15-20 minutes walk to the Colleseaum. The lobby is very pleasant but the room we had was barely big enough for the small double bed we had. The decor was very dated and the bathroom fittings were all coming off the wall. Definitely not worth the apparent €250 a night price tag. It was barely worth the €80 price tag through our online agency. Staff were very pleasant, and it was not the worse place I have stayed in, I would compare it to a Good 2* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad Hotel, Bad Location, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anacondas
Reviews.Content: Doesn't worth anything, was really bad. The location, was not clean enough and the breakfast was awful, we where eating outside every day.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kolya_11
Reviews.Content: We had a quite good rest in this Hotel. Room could be a little bigger, but if you come there to sleep after a long walking day, it's perfect. Our window ( six floor) looked on the noisy street ,but once you close the window it was quiet. Our air-condition worked good and most important it was very quiet. Location of the Hotel is perfect: two small blocks to Termini Station, were you have Metro, Buses, trams and trains. From the airport Fumicino, express train takes you in 30 minutes to Termini Station. In the walking distance located Colosseo, Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore and Piazza Venezia , just to name few. Staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. We would like to express our deep gratefulness to Mr. Massimo. He is especially friendly and helpfull. His English is perfect and he helped us a lot with our questions about reaching places of our interest, booking tickets, and with other problems of newcomer in Rome. We definitely recommend this Hotel to stay in. :)

Reviews.Title: “Typical European hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sjpricey23
Reviews.Content: This is your typical European hotel,excellent location,within walking distance to all the main sights. Rooms were a good size with decent bathroom(did need a good scrub though),wardrobe,mini bar,hairdryer. Breakfast was good, the staff were constantly re-filling,busiest time being 08.30. The hotel close by to the termini station which is a bonus not far too walk. Lots of small restataunts near the hotel with good value for money and good food, small supermarket just around the corner too. The hotel receptionists were very helpful in booking taxi's and suggesting where to visit first, don't leave without a map ! Overall this hotel is excellent value for money in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Near to station, surrounding was pretty noisy”
Reviews.Author: BambangKaro
Reviews.Content: Very near to Termini Central Station. Room is nice and clean, but can hear people talking outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Rounded Review”
Reviews.Author: carlosfandang
Reviews.Content: So, GF and I did a 4 day trip to Rome with LastMinute. We read the reviews and were anxious, but In short we had a great stay. I'm a Brit and these are my honest opinions. INITIAL IMPRESSIONS - The hotel is old style glamour with a bit of wear and tear - loved it. If you want a modern, all singing, all dancing expensive Intercontinental, then go there. (pay for what you get) STAFF - The staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. If you're pushy, as Italians are, they will treat you the same, we were very relaxed and they were very helpful, letting us know about all the best places to go, etc. ROOMS - they are comfortable, not huge, but perfectly adequate if you're using it as a base for travel and sleeping. The bathrooms are "cosy" (I'm 6 foot 2), but how long do you need to spend in there! Aircon is on the gentle side (fine in April) - suspect a little bit inadequate for hot summer months. Yes, you can here a bit of noise from other rooms, but most hotels are like this. TV is just Italian channels and the fridge is sparsely stocked. No WIFI. BREAKFAST - good rooftop views, breakfast is generally cereal, bread rolls, meat, cheese, boiled eggs, juices, tea/coffee, etc - as much as you want - no fruit, but certainly hardy enough for setting you up for walking Rome. SUMMARY - it is a quaint, reasonable hotel located very close (2 mins walk) to Termini and is ideal for using as a B&B. If you want SKY/WiFi and the full Monty, then pay more and go to a modern chain hotel. The 4 stars maybe misleading depending on what you want - but remember this is Europe rating and not UK or US. THIS IS ROME - quirky, bussly and bloddy good fun. Take it as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElViajero40
Reviews.Content: Definitely Not a 4 star hotel!!! The hotel has a very good ubication, and thats it, if you are going to rome to walk every day from morning to night and just come tired to the hotel to sleep, it is ok, but if you are looking for tv, it doesn't work (14 inch small and old tv), breakfast is basic and they clode the dining room exactly at 09.30. Not very clean, but it is close to the Termini and don't miss to eat in Cecio, 20 meters from the hotel. in Principe Amedeo street.

Reviews.Title: “Ummmm, what to say....”
Reviews.Author: bookieboy
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a secret hotel on lastminute.com. After reading the reviews, I was very worried by the other reviews I had read. We arrived and checked into our room very quickly, which was great as the weather was fab and we wanted to go outside. The room we had was on the 5th floor and over looked a busy street - this caused a problem it was c25 degrees durin the day and nights were v warm also. The air con did not work (it was pumping out heat!!) and we could not sleep as when we opened the window it was TOO loud! I rang mgmt and they gave us a fan. The next morning I went down to reception and spoke to the manager - I explained that the hotel advertises air con and we could not sleep due to the temperature in the room last night. The manager explained that the system can only heat or cool the air and can not be switched over on a daily basis (due to it being an old system). He also explained that the weather we were getting was not normal and temperatures should only b c14 degrees in April - and to be fair this was a valid point. He told us to pack our bags, go out to the city and enjoy our day and he would move us to a new room. That he did, we moved to the third floor, a big room with two windows, one of which was facing the quiet street so we could open the window. We had no issues with our new room and we even had the fan transferred from our old room (the old room was like a box room compared to the new one!). In general we were happy with our second room but i would have been extremely unhappy had we not moved (watch out in high season as hotel might not have capacity to move room). The breakfast was terrible really, we went up our first morning and didn't go back but hey, for me that was not a big issue. The location of hotel is good, you can walk to the centre of Rome in 15/20 mins. The hotel (based on our second room) served it purpose, to sleep, as we hardly spent any time in the room - there is so much to do in Rome so u should not be in ur room! If ur looking for comfort and a "true" 4 star hotel, this is not the place for you. However, if ur looking for a bed to assist in exploring this great city and u get a good offer on the room, then it's an ok spot. If i was going back, I would try somewhere else tho as we it was not impressive enuf to go back to, however unless you are willing to pay huge money, I hear all hotels in the centre will be similar to this!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Lucyandfc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the last two years and it does have it's faults but I have always found the staff to be excellent and friendly. Rooms, breakfast and showers are good. Location is great and you can access everywhere on foot or by bus. If you like tours then green tours are just around the corner. Downside could be lack of wifi but if you need the net you have loads of Internet cafes close buy. To sum up if you are not a fussy tourist then you will be more than happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep for entire holiday”
Reviews.Author: science_299
Reviews.Content: The general standard of the hotel is OK, it's clean enough. It's a fairly typical Italian hotel which claims a star or two more than it should have. There's nothing in the mini bar, nothing in the drawers, no wifi (free or paid), no restaurant and no bar. Most importantly we didn't get more than 3 hours continuous sleep on any of the three nights we stayed. Each morning we were woken by the cleaners shouting between rooms and chatting on their phones from 7.30am onwards (6.30 our time). If we did get back to sleep we were woken again by the cleaners banging on our door at 9am. During the night I was woken repeatedly by other guests flushing their toilets, and by the heating which came on at around 1am and couldn't be switched off. There's only one key card per room, too, so if you happen to be sleeping near someone who can't get in to their room at 3am you will certainly hear about it. The first morning we went for breakfast (only served til 9.30am) and I was so tired I was actually holding back tears in the breakfast roo. The food was pretty dreadful, even for a continental breakfast - juice mixed from concentrate, really horrid cheap coffee, stale cereal and pastries. The 'panoramic' view from the breakfast room is fine if you enjoy gazing at TV aerials. The reception staff were also pretty unhelpful. They pulled faces when we presented a 50 euro note to pay for 18 euro tax, and refused to print off one page of A4, asking us to go to the internet cafe by the station instead. The lack of rest completely ruined our holiday, and by the time we checked out we were glad to be going home. It's a two-star crash pad for an early train - not a four star hotel by any means - and we will be making a complaint to lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and has Latin charm”
Reviews.Author: waywoodwanderer
Reviews.Content: I saw some other reviews after booking the hotel and had some trepidation but we found the hotel to be good, clean and the view from the breakfast room on the top floor was outstanding. Getting from Rome Termini meant walking through some iffy looking streets but if we had walked through to the front entrance of the the termini then to the hotel it is fine. Its only about 100m. We went out the side entrance by mistake. In any case you get used to graffiti in Rome after a while as its everywhere like the scooters. Its close enough to most sites to allow you to walk but the metro is OK and a combined tram/bus/metro ticket is 4 euros a day if you dont want to walk. Really nice walk from top of spanish steps (3 metro stops) north to the park. Super views across the city and its downhill all the way to St Peters. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “made our stay”
Reviews.Author: Captain7Brooka
Reviews.Content: i believe people are put on this earth to moan,Having booked on a last minute deal ,but then reading the reviews put us on our alert,however who ever sends negative reports about this hotel must think that for the price they pay only the Ritz will do We have stayed in many hotels round the world and this was excellent,great room,good decor,clean,very good bathroom,helpful staff ,anything you wanted for breakfast,location great 250 metres from central transport system,and going the other way right into the area of collo,forum,trevi fountain and vatican,what more can you ask for,Shame on the people who give the Champagne Palace bad reports,just a suggestion to these idiots,Why don,t you stay at home you miserable gits

Reviews.Title: “Dirty place”
Reviews.Author: magdoo
Reviews.Content: Certain spots in bathroom was never cleaned, hair everywhere, in room walls are filthy. There are many rooms that are totally different from the photos on web. Breakfast is really bad, too.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: suhruthu
Reviews.Content: I must admit that we went to this hotel half heartedly. I had booked this hotel through lastminute.de, as they had told at the time of booking that it was a booking with the possibility of free cancellation. But when I read many of the bad reviews, I attempted to cancel our booking and then only lastminute.de told that they will charge 30 euros as administrative fee for any cancellations/ modifications. So half heartedly we decided not to cancel our booking and stayed in this hotel. But the hotel was not that bad as we expected (or lets say our expectations were very low, after reading the reviews!!). The positive things about this hotel - extremely friendly and helpful staff, proximity to Roma termini station (just 2-3 minutes to the station), the possibility to keep your luggage free of cost even after check out. The negative aspects - Rooms are really small (bath cubicles are the worst!!! Could never expect such a small bath tray in any 4 star hotel!); The area of this hotel doesn't appear really safe at late nights; terribly old television sets in room; empty fridge (never expected from a 4 star hotel!); over all quality is just of a 1-2 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4* HOTEL BY ANY STRETCH OF THE IMAGINATION”
Reviews.Author: KelCumbriaUK
Reviews.Content: The location is about 5 mins walk from the Termini station which I thought would be an advantage but was in reality terrible - very dirty area. Lots of graffiti, litter & beggars. Not a pleasant first impression at all and not for the faint hearted as it was quite intimidating walking through there at night. The room we had was tiny - barely enough room to walk around the bed, no tea or coffee making facilities, only 1 plug, only 1 drawer and missing light fittings. The bathroom was the width of a shower tray and when you were sat on the toilet your knees were touching the wall! The TV was ancient and there was no wi-fi - which from a "4*" hotel should be standard! There was also absolutely no privacy at all as every single sound made could be heard in other rooms. We could hear the people in the room opposite coughing loudly, and every time someone used a hairdryer or flushed the toilet it could be heard as if it was in our room. The other residents made a lot of other noise which made it impossible to sleep for at least 2 nights of our stay, as there was literally no soundproofing anywhere in this place. The cleanliness wasn't great either. There were dirty finger prints all over the door handles etc, and the bathroom floor hadn't been mopped. The beds were made everyday however, although I don't know whether clean sheets were used everyday. Breakfast was basic but bearable - if you're not fussy. The photos advertising this hotel are deceptive. They've taken the best but conveniently left out what you are likely to get!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Oscie10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently having had cheap deal. Was worried paying cheap would mean awful however this was not the case. Checking in was simple, staff very friendly spoke good English. Rooms were slighty small but big enough for us! Our room looked like it had been recently painted so was bright and clean. Bed linen was spotless!!! Room was cleaned daily as were clean towels put out. Breakfast was basic but was nice enough! Location of this hotel is a bit "dodgy" however so close to main train station that kind of made up for it. Would defo stay again and recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are only staying a few nights and plan on getting out and about alot.”
Reviews.Author: LondonXandra
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel late at night, and I was without a suitcase as it did not arrive with my flight, but none of this phased them- the front desk was helpful considering the time of night. The room, however, was a disappointment! Whilst we had only paid for a single room, it was so small that I could place a hand on each wall, the TV was tiny, the decor was dated and the bed was like a camp bed! Breakfast was fair, though nothing special. To their credit, they did give both me and my friend a much bigger, double room each after the first 2 nights, they kept me informed on my missing luggage, they were helpful with directions, and the location was very good for both the Termini Station, and all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star 2 star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chivamex
Reviews.Content: We went in Vacations to Europe this past Month I will really recomend to dont stay here. For us was really unpleasent the stay. The hotel is really old they dont have well maintainance . The bathroom was leaking . One day we came back and the women who cleans the room left our room open. The breackfast is terrible just coffee and bread . No fruit in the breackfast no Yougurgh so no spend more and look for other Hotel is Terrible. The only good thing is that is very well located with the central Termini but that is about it. The location is not the most beautiful in Rome is dirty . They are a lot other location that you can stay that are beautiful i thought this location was going to be the best but rally is not . Look in The Plaza Spa;ia or near via Veneto this are beautiful areas to stay. Hope this help you in your trip

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, great location!”
Reviews.Author: scottishsaphire
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk from the Termini station, this hotel is in a great location, and not in the shady part. Plenty of cafes and bars around, perfectly safe to walk around at night. Friendly and helpful staff, advised us on the best ways to get around town, and let us check in early. Breakfast was a normal continental breakfast and perfectly adequate. For the price and location a super hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: flair28
Reviews.Content: The service we received was excellent although, apart from check-in and out, we had no real direct contact with staff. Cleaners came in every day(although they had missed a previous occupants sock that was behind the curtain!!!) and breakfast was nice. Location for us was fantastic. Right near the Termini station (3-min walk) and was only 10-mins walk from the Colloseum. Quite a bit of traffic noise can be heard but then you're right near a main station, so I was expecting that. Having looked at the pictures, I was very disappointed with the room we got. It was very pokey, looked quite shabby, the air conditioning vent was loose on the wall and the bathroom looked very dated. I think the television was about the same age as me (and I'm 31!) and the remote didn't work. Also, only Italian channels. Bed was comfortable and there was a free safe in the room, so that was good. To be fair, we didn't spend long in the room so it wasn't that much of a problem, as we were only there 3 nights. Overall, the location was excellent for us, all major attractions in the city were within 30-mins walking, and the hotel was a reasonable price. However, I wouldn't stay in here for more than a couple of days. I would suggest our room was NOT 4-star quality. Get this at a deal price, you should be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFogg1873
Reviews.Content: We paid for a 4 star hotel but In reality this a 3 star hotel. The room was tiny and we had to request it was cleaned as the floor was sticky and there was dust everywhere. The TV only showed local channels and was something from the 1980's. Breakfast was included but was quite unpleasant so we skipped it. The room had good noise insulation from outside noise but the interior doors were very cheap and so you could hear every movement in the corridor. Only plus was that the hotel was close to the main station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: chris_laura28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was actually a brilliant find! It was great value for money (we paid £160 for 3 nights over a weekend). We didn't expect much for the price we paid but knew that the location was good so thought it was worth a gamble. We booked the rome crypts and catacombs tour with dark rome - would highly recommend it. It was nice to see a different part of Rome that is not on the normal itineraries. The hotel was easy to find, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. Couldn't fault it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...”
Reviews.Author: doos
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. The room was OK but not very clean, staff werent great. We couldnt find the remote for the TV, when we called reception they said they will sort it out. They came up to the room with a remote but wanted 10 euros as a deposit! Breakfast was OK but not the best, the hotel is busy and lots of people in the breakfast room at the same time but the food is not topped up regularly...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations/”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles24000
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative comments about this hotel I really didn't know what to expect. First impressions were that the hotel was very inviting and the reception staff friendly an informative. My room was on the first floor and it was small but thats to be expected in a european hotel, but clean. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was spacious but the walk in shower was very small and as I'm on the larger side I just squeezed in. The TV channels were all in Italian and it was abit noisy at night. For example you could hear my neighbours TV and constant doors slamming. The cleaning staff were also really loud and shouted alot. I didn't have breakfast as it was too early for me and alot of the doors allowing me to find my room were proped open with fire extinguishers which was weird. The air conditioning in my room worked tho and the hotel is in excellent location to Termini station. All I wanted was somewhere clean and comfortable and a good base for my stay and thats what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and good price, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: chocolat61
Reviews.Content: Breakfast on 7th floor with splendid view, but the elevator is slow and there is one (also for the cleaners) so you might end up walking up there. Breakfast very basic, no fruit. Unexpectedly the air condition worked well in the room, so all in all it was ok - but never 4 stars, rather 2.5. Walking distance to Termini is very convenient, Check out on last day at 10am rather early.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: HollyMarie89
Reviews.Content: First impressions were good, the receptionist was friendly enough and the hotel was easy to find from the station. However, we arrived to find we had a twin room instead of a double which we booked. We complained, and were almost downgraded to a smaller, smellier room which didn't have hot running water initially. The cleaning staff were very rude. The hotel was also very noisey at night, you can hear what is going on in all the rooms around. Not what we would expect for a 4* hotel. You pay for the location. Not recommended for those who want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “No frills 3* - and that's what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: little_L86
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in many reviews before, this hotel is more akin to a no frills 3* - but that is what you are paying for. You can't really expect a great 4* hotel if you are paying around €100 a night, or less in a city like Rome. LOCATION: Nice stroll in good weather down to 'Ancient Rome' i.e. colosseum, roman forum etc. Plenty of eateries etc on the way down too. SERVICE: Was fine on the front desk, although we didn't really speak to them much BREAKFAST: We didn't have breakfast in the hotel ROOMS: Average european size, cheap furniture and smallish bathroom. Shower sometimes didn't have hot water, or only very lukewarm water. This was our main problem. Room service was pretty good and regular though. OVERALL: Did the job, and is a handy enough base to stay in Rome if you don't want to pay for the extras you would expect in a 4*. Overall, I would not return though.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy but Clean and Decent”
Reviews.Author: BSnydely
Reviews.Content: Champagne Palace was clean, well located, and very workable. The rooms aren't large, but quiet for Rome. Very basic breakfast. Plenty of hot water, the air conditioning worked, and the hotel staff was friendly. For my family, this place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Egilsm
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, reasonably priced and with fair quality of rooms and services. The quality of the breakfast was not good enough, with little variety, eggs that arrived late, bread from the day before and drinking water at room temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews we had read!!”
Reviews.Author: BridgetDorset
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very convenient part of Rome for walking distance to all the major sites.We literally dropped our bags off at the hotel which was only minutes from the station & started our itinery.The room was very clean & adequate for a short break- buffet style breakfast continental style which you could help yourself to as much as you want.We were also able to leave our cases in the hotel on our last day to pick up later that evening.Staff also helpful. Rome - the sites are amazing ,but the city is spoilt by gypsies/beggars/graffiti artists etc.,

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: lesiure-traveller
Reviews.Content: Grandly titled but did not live up to expectation. Stayed 7 nights in total and was exhausted by the time of leaving Rome. Did not have one comfortable night. Room was very small, and tha layout of the bathroom was awkward....had to walk past the toliet and bidet sideways to avoid burning skin on the hottest towel rail you are likely to come across (temperature of the towel rail cannot be altered). Had a particulatly noisy room (above reception). Could hear the telephone ringing in reception throughout the night. Asked to move room, but told not possible. Also requested extra pillows on 3 separate occasions, and eventually gave up! Lift and marble staircase also very noisy with late arriving guests slamming doors etc. In summary, a decent base and competitively priced (by Rome standards!) but defintely not a four star and would not recommend staying any longer than a couple of nights. If you are looking to viist Rome to celebrate an anniversary / birthday etc, this is not the place to stay. Push the boat out and stay in one of Rome's many fine hotels, we realised "Rome on the Cheap" is not worth the disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: emmajade7
Reviews.Content: lovely helpful staff. room small but Reception moved us when requested. Great views over rome. very happy

Reviews.Title: “more like the pommagne palace”
Reviews.Author: faytough
Reviews.Content: No way is this 4 star -more like 2 star. The reception area had a teribble smell , our room was tiny and roof top terrace for breakfast horrible. Breakfast very basic. No bar or sitting room or lounge areas. Photos are no resemblence to hotel. We stayed out all day so only had to sleep in hotel. Awful hotel and just because it's central does not make up for the poor standard. Would have prefferred to say in the outskirts than in a dump like this.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: CRYPTO2008
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of this hotel were not good. Upon arrival, I found I'd been put into a fairly small room. When I went for a shower, I discovered there was no hot water! Then, I realised the sound from the Reception a floor below was audable within my room, including the ringing of the phone. However, when I asked to be moved rooms to further up the hotel, this was done with no problems, and my new room was quiet, larger and had hot water. The location is fairly good - it's about 15-20 minutes walk from The Colluseum and very close to the Sante Maria Maggoire. However, the area around the main station is not the best. Breakfast is fine - though I did spot a bug crawling on the wall near the cereal one morning! The view at the breakfast room is amazing, being so high up. The staff were friendly enough, and helpful when I asked them advice on the area. There is no internet access in this hotel. Overall, an ok hotel to stay in, but don't believe it deserves the 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Mrben86
Reviews.Content: Last minute deal on the internet, seemed a very very good price for a 4* hotel. This hotel was certainly not a 4*. Rooms were very small and lacked basic amenities and look nothing like how the website shows them. There was a TV with a few Italian fuzzy channels but no kettle or bath. The safe did not work although reception allowed us to use their safe - not ideal. The staff were pleasant enough. The hotel has a lounging area downstairs but it's very small and they refused to serve us coffee despite a large coffee machine and bar by saying it was shut and not opening any time soon. The location is good if you want to travel all around Rome because of the station and the metro about 100 yards up the road. However, do not walk around this area at night especially around the Termini Station. We found this out the hard way. It's not pleasant and once we realised this we left promptly. The main centre of Rome nightlife seems to be up the Corso and near Piazza Navona and this is a good 15-20 minute walk (which is fine if you like walking) but we spotted other places we would rather have stayed along the way. Recommend only if you get a cheap deal and expect a 3* only to use as a base for your travelling (i.e. somewhere to wash and sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: foxypear
Reviews.Content: The Champagne Palace is well situated by the train station with easy access to the Metro, Bus Terminus, Trams and trains. The rooms are on the small side but the furniture and fitting are of a high standard and carpet on the floor is a bonus, the bathrooms are very small, though well fitted out. View from our room unfortunately was the fire escape but on the whole was a comfortable room. The continental breakfast left alot to be desired, small cereal bowls and poor choice of cereal and pastries. With either one choice of ham or tasteless cheese. Rome itself is a beautiful city with plenty to see, beware of the ticket touts at all the attractions especially the Vatican who tout tickets to "beat the queue's" when we walked past them to find there were no queues at all! Be prepared for plenty of walking so take a comfy pair of shoes. We were alittle disapointed with the standard & choice of food in the restaurants for such a big city overpriced and little choice. Would definately recommend a trip to Rome though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a 4* hotel though”
Reviews.Author: shanepcarty
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in champagne palace, the hotel itself is in a brilliant location but the hotel is far from being a four star... The staff were reasonably friendly.. on entering the room we saw that it was a little cramped but wasnt too bad, the worst was when we went into the bathroom, there was a smell off dampness in it and it was quite overwhelming, this is because there is no extractor fan in it... The hotel was fine for a one off, it'd go back to rome again but i wouldnt stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel unhelpful staff avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Sussex-Pilot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Champagne for 4 nights during February half term. We booked through lastminuite.com who market it as Fantastic 4 star Hotel just minutes from the Colosseum! In reality this is nearer to a 2 star hotel even for Rome, having visited the city twice before and staying at hotels in the area. Although close to rail/metro station Colosseum is a good 30 minutes walk. The hotel itself seems reasonably smart in reception, however rooms were cramped with poor facilities. Bathroom was small and unclean with cracked shower tray, and our shower was so small that you couldn’t move your arms without smashing into screen. Rooms always seemed hot and stuffy as there was no extract fan fitted in bathroom. We had problems with door locks, safe, and satellite TV which had a choice of 7 fuzzy channels all in Italian. Staff on reception seemed reasonably helpful at first, but by the third day we could tell that they weren’t interested in complaints and reminiscent of a episode of Fawlty Towers. Breakfast is served on the seventh floor and is probably the best room in the Hotel; however staff seemed to watch you’re every move and were unhelpful. The breakfast itself was reasonable if not a little limited. There are no facilities for any other catering at the hotel not even a bar or coffee machine for hot drinks. We queried this at reception as it rained most of the week we were there and finding somewhere to relax with a drink is not always easy. In conclusion this is a hotel to avoid and we will book more carefully in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Staff unfriendly, breakfast appauling, rooms small and unclean”
Reviews.Author: macy-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Champagne Hotel for four nights in mid-February, as a group of four. We arrived to a hotel that didn't look nice from the outside, but appeared nicer inside from the extensive use of marble. Staff were helpful and pleasant and our check-in was swift. Our rooms were very small and the bathrooms tiny. One bathroom was so unclean the room had to be changed for another with a smaller bathroom, which seemed of little bother to staff. The showers in both bathrooms were minute. The decor was traditional Italian, with marble bathrooms. Neither extractor fans worked, causing very hot rooms. Walls were thin, we could hear the neighbours 'activites' throughout the night. Both safes in the rooms had problems, sealing belongings inside them. These issues were fairly quickly resolved by staff, again who seemed untroubled by the inconvience. Beds were stripped with clean sheets and towels every day, no complaints there. However there were no tea making facilities, all of the television channels were in Italian (despite paying 10 euros for a remote with the promise of English channels) and the door to our rooms didn't lock at all. Breakfast was a different experience completely. It was served on the 7th floor, the top floor of the hotel but thankfully there was a lift. The continental breakfast seemed very meagre and the breakfast staff seemed to be watching your every move. The bread rolls were tough and chewy, the milk and fruit juice powdery and the hot water either lukewarm or boiling hot. The pastries were certainly enjoyable, but when our group took a few wrapped in napkins to take with us for the day we were greeted with very frosty looks from one particular member of staff. The following morning the same thing happened, although he paid closer attention to what we were taking from the breakfast counter. He also studied the napkin parcels that were on our table, watching where they were. As we left the breakfast room on the 3rd day he peered into one of our groups handbags presumably to look for the offending pastries. It wasn't until our fourth and final morning when he told us that 'cakes were not allowed out of the breakfast room', though for a hotel that does not provide a lunch or dinner service, let alone a bar, it was unfair to only provide a limited breakfast. He seemed particularly unhappy about the 'cakes' as many other members of the hotel had noticed and were doing the same thing. The coffee bar on the ground floor was not opened at all in the five days that we were in the hotel, and nor was the alcholic bar on the top floor. When two members of our group ventured up to the top floor to relax on the balcony with a glass of wine they found the floor to be locked with no access available. Although reception staff were friendly, helpful and spoke English, their good manners were overshadowed by the resentment from the breakfast staff. The lack of facilities made for an uncomfortable stay which shouldn't have been. Rome itself was very enjoyable, lots of sights to see and bus trips to take. Constant haggling from street sellers was irritating. The location of the hotel was fantastic though, just under a five minute walk to the 'Station Termini' (train station) where bus services left from every few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Charle_10
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Champagne Palace for three nights. We had a warm welcome, room small but perfect for a city break. This is not a four star hotel, but if you acept that it will be fine for your visit to Rome. It is central, breakfast is fine and the views from the eating area are fantastic. Highly recommend for a city break if you get a good deal on price.

Reviews.Title: “totally fulfilled our requirements,clean, warm well located”
Reviews.Author: oulpete
Reviews.Content: This hotel served our purpose well, it was clean warm and staff were very helpful with directions. English was spoken. Breakfast was self-service continental in a bright rooftop room. The location was 10 minutes from the Metro Termini which made getting around Rome much more pleasureable.

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: mjfisher72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable, close to the station and a good base for exploring the city... we walked practically everywhere and saw loads. breakfast wasn't fantastic but there was plenty of it and the view from the dining room across the city was a nice start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing...”
Reviews.Author: MTGTMG
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel 3 months prior to our arrival (it was a surprise 50th birthday present)..we arrived around midnight on new years day and checked in without any problems..the problem arose when we were expected to stay in a hotel on the opposite side of the street for our 1st night as all the rooms in Champagne Palce were occupied. Now if your like me you would expect that booking 3 months in advance would and should have ensured a room as decribed and payed for in advance. My partner was devastated that my birthday had been spoiled...the staff apologised and promised that tomorrow we would be moved to our room. This is not a good start, especially when you are only staying for three nights. The next day we were moved to the Champagne Palace and the room was very nice..However! this hotel is in a very busy area of Rome, we were on the 3rd floor on a corner of the building and the traffic noise- especially the trams which run all night prevented us from sleeping. The hotels decor is typical Italian and quite charming, the room service was prompt- although the hotel didn't have an ice bucket!...the staff were very helpfull and friendly at all times. Breakfast is served in what can only be described as...'a room that is totally inadequate' All in all the hotel is at best 3star .....had we known this we would have chosen another and paid the extra...Champagne Palace needs to address a few areas if they are to get a 4 star reputation. M&T from Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: bream
Reviews.Content: We booked the Champagne Palace through Lastminute.com as a 'Secret Hotel' it was described as 4 star just minutes from the Coliseum. In truth it was 2 star, the room was about 12ft by 12ft not including the ‘corridor from the door, the ‘wardrobe’ consisted of a cupboard with 6 hangers, 2 drawers and a fridge (mini bar). The bathroom had a shower where the door did not close properly letting water all over the floor and a sink without a plug, when I asked about a plug for the sink I was told I needed to pay a deposit of 10 Euro’s (I thought everyone encouraged going ‘green’ and saving water). The TV was a small portable in a recess next to the wardrobe but did have a remote (I must have been lucky). The breakfast was in a small room on the top floor and was the normal continental type but with a choice of horrible coffee from one machine or of horrible coffee from another, the juice was from concentrate that left a ‘sludge’ in the bottom of the glass. The claim of “Minutes from the Coliseum” was true (About 20 minutes in fact if you walked). In truth the only thing it was close to was the station which was 5 minutes away. Would I stay again No would I recommend it again No.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe all you read - great stay !!”
Reviews.Author: angela7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Champagne Palace Hotel from November 28 until December 2nd, and had a very nice time. The staff on the front desk were all EXCELLENT, including MASSIMO who was extremely helpful. The reception area was clean, the room was spotless, the sheets were sparkling white and changed every day as would be the norm. The shower was a bit small, but quite adequate for a hotel. This hotel was three minutes walk to Termini Train Station, was five minute walk to the Hop On Hop Off bus, and three minute walk to the Metro, which made our trip much easier to get around and see Rome. In the vicinity there are many excellent restaurants and cafes, with reasonable prices. For those people who have said bad things about this hotel, I think perhaps they are being spiteful. It was good value for money and we would have no hesitation in staying there again. Big thanks to MASSIMO and all the staff who helped make out stay very pleasant. Yes, our room was absolutely spotless....I would not hesitate to recommend it to people, and I stay at hotels all over the world on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: mickymc
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews, but just got back from a stay here with my girlfriend and we decided to write a positive one for this hotel. We had booked our stay as a mystery hotel and having read the reviews we were dreading coming to it. However we were pleasantly surprised, Here's a quick summary: The room was very clean and smart although quite small. The breakfast had a wide range and was good. Location is brilliant due to it's proximity to Stazione Termini. Staff are friendly and helpful. Also, we didn't have bed bugs and don't be put off by previous bad reviews. Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad experience, though not truly 4*”
Reviews.Author: LegallyFond
Reviews.Content: I, like many others on this site, had already booked the hotel through lastminute.com as a 'secret hotel', so coming onto this site afterwards to check it out wasn't to advise me whether to stay here it not; it was more a case of preparing me for what was in store. With so many scathing reviews, I was prepared for the worst, even laying some money aside to change hotels if really necessary. But it wasn't that bad. Starting with the positives, this is literally a stone's throw away from the main station (Roma Termini), which saved a taxi fare on arrival. It's also near plenty of other attractions - I walked around the City almost all of the time. It's five minutes from the Opera, a good fifteen-twenty minutes walk to the Colusseum and a similar distance to many other attractions. The area that the hotel's in isn't dodgy as such, but it's certainly not one of the nicer areas of Rome. I put it down to being near a train station - in London you'd probably have much the same thing in a similar location. Now the negatives... many people on here had complained about bedbugs or over starched sheets. Not one to take chances, I brought along my silk sleeping bag liner and used that on the bed, so I can't comment on it. But to the hands, the sheets did feel quite chemically treated. It certainly wasn't the same as 4* bedding I'd seen in other hotels during my trip. The only thing which really annoyed me on this trip - many on here had complained about tiny TVs in the room. I was stunned to find a 32 inch flatscreen on the wall of my room, but couldn't find the remote. When I went downstairs to ask where it might be, I was told that I'd need to be a 10 euro (refundable) deposit to use a remote control as the televisions were so new. Out of principle, I refused to pay this. I was still able to operate the TV manually, but this meant getting out of bed to change the channel or volume so I didn't watch it that much. This was a really pointless policy of theirs which is another thing which I am certain a 4* hotel (or even any hotel with a sensible business model) wouldn't do. The facilities were OK, but again, not 4* standard. The room and hotel generally were relatively dated, but some of the furniture in the room was nice (solid wooden desk with inlaid marquetry), if you appreciate that thing. The bathroom was a mild disappointment. Perfectly functional and with marble walls/floor, but the age/condition overshadowed the very use of such material. The soap dish in the shower was rusty and the dimensions of the bathroom were slightly inconvenient. The complementary products were fairly basic; you might expect a bit more from a supposed 4*. The thing is, due to the deal I got online, I was only paying about £42 per night for this hotel. I think I got what I paid for.
