It certainly wasn't 4* and I think if I went again, I'd happily go for a 3* in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sunchaserLondon
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I stayed at the same hotel as the other people who have written negative reviews but thank god I took no notice and booked this hotel. To get the negatives out of the way, firstly the room was very hot, air condition didn't appear to work (but we just left our window open all day and came back to a cooler room!) No Iron in hotel . Bar/ drinks room was shut for our entire stay. Room was slightly on the small side with a small wardrobe ( I think they have built the rooms around the concept of short breaks and people not spending hours in there room, fair enough Rome is all about the sights) That's it now the good bits.... The hotel is in the most convenient location literally a three min walk to the main train and bus station, it is in a nice part of Rome with plenty going on, many places to eat and drink, Internet, phone shops all within two minutes of your hotel. The Termini itself is like a shopping mall worthwhile taking some time out to have a peek around that. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful, giving directions, maps and advice. Always a smile when we returned in and were never bothered by my endless questions. The entire hotel is spotless, our rooms were cleaned everyday, fresh towels and sheets and the beds were the most comfortable I have slept in. gorgeous. And no we didn't have bed bugs!! To round it up, if your looking for a friendly, clean , convenient, central hotel then the Champagne Palace is for you , enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hot, tepid shower, bed bugs, small, noisy, broken fridge, horrible”
Reviews.Author: scarmat
Reviews.Content: I thought I had found a bargain with this hotel, but everything about it was disappointing. The room was tiny and boiling hot. The management refused to activate the air conditioning on the basis that it was October (even though it was blistering outside). Our fridge was broken so everything in it was warm but, typically the water in the shower was tepid. It was so hot at night I was unable to sleep, occasionally, in desparation I would open a window but the noise of the trains was tortuous and meant that I was still unable to sleep. Breakfast was bordering on inedible (stale bread with slices of mortadella and kraft cheese I think) I think Rome is the most fabulous city on earth and even this horrible hotel couldn't spoil it but I wouldn't recommend this place to a dog. I complained repeatedly and eventually was given eur 40 off my eur 400 bill (for 3 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but has bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Fushia1
Reviews.Content: A good location for exploring Rome with the termini station for great access in and out of Rome. My partener and I stayed for 3 nights last week and have both since returned with bed bug bites, so just beware of that. Also, you'll prob need a cappucino stop mid morning as breakfast coffee was awful......especially for italy!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* Not a 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas247
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend. Definitely not a 4* star hotel. Although I would happily class this as a good 3* hotel. Hotel is in a good location for all the major sites. Metro less than 5 mins walk away. Hotel and room was very clean. Beds were comfortable. Clean towels ever day and room was cleaned to a good standard. Although the road outside was busy it was always quite in the room. Breakfast was your typical continental, which was Ok. Coffee was good, although the fruit juices did taste as if they were watered down. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right. If you thought you were staying in a 4* hotel and you paid 4* prices, you would be very disappointed. We got a good price and thought it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in an excellent location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Linnie68
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay in Rome through Lastminute's secret hotel and although we got a really good deal (less than £80 a night including breakfast) we were really concerned when we read the reviews. Maybe not the most attractive hotel from the outside and a little quaint and dated on the inside we found the rooms to be clean and comfortable, the breakfast sufficient, the staff pleasant and helpful and thought it was an ideal hotel for a short stay in Rome. We had a fantastic time and managed to see all the main attractions in two days. The hop on bus was a great way to get around and the metro was easy to use but we found some of the best sights on foot and most were in easy walking distance of the hotel. Visit 's inside the colleseum and the Vatacan are a must and we found that it is best to just wait in the queue rather than to pay extra for a guided tour and suposed queue jump which wasnt needed to enjoy these fantastic places - overall we had a great time and cant wait to visit Italy again one day.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: neverdoneroaming
Reviews.Content: After having booked this hotel with lastminute.com as a secret hotel we then read the reviews and were a bit worried. We should not have been at all. The hotel staff were excellent, we booked into our room at midday with no problem as the room was ready for us. We asked for an extra pillow when we arrived in the room and it was brought up immediately. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was lovely with a great shower. The breakfast was European but very good and plenty of it. The location was excellent a 2 minute walk from Termini Station with a great restaurant just up the street, Ristorante Alfredo. Do not believe what you read about this hotel, not sure what people expect when they go to Europe, maybe they aren't well travelled and expect 4* accomodation equivalent to uk or maybe they are just empty swanks. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: keane269
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week found it great it was spotless and the room was cleaned every day. Its beside the bus and train station and near to all the sights breakfast was basic but nice the staff where friendly and helpful. great value for money and i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star.”
Reviews.Author: SomewhereLoll
Reviews.Content: After staying in an amazing 4* hotel in Venice we were expecting the same at Hotel Champagne but did not find it! This hotel was booked through lastminute.com as a mystery hotels. It is not a 4* hotel, possibly a 3* or 2*. The reception staff were kind and helpful. Straight away we tried to get into our room and the card hadn't been activated so we had to go back down to reception. Next I had a shower and the water wouldn't drain so another trip to reception (but this problem was rectified quickly). The air conditioning was more like a fan hidden in the wall. The room could have done with a clean, the bathroom smelt of smoke and there was mould growing in places in the bathroom. The room was cleaned every day. The television was old and there was no WI FI access. The breakfast in the morning was ok. They appear to have a hidden stash of yoghurts and fruit in the kitchen which you have to ask for! If you are looking for a central hotel which is going to be used as a base for exploring Rome then I would recomment this hotel as the location is excellent. But if you're looking more, then I would find another hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Location and breakfast well. Nice but small room.”
Reviews.Author: DanmarkBente
Reviews.Content: Hotel near the train and metro. We were satisfied to stay at this hotel. The breakfast was very good. The room was clean, but small. The shawer small and defect. The aircondition cools but makes noise. The employed are kindly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: tabhow
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on here i was very worried all i can say is i found the hotel value for money in a great location. went for three nights and as the location was so good managed to fit everything in. Breakfast was lovely set you up for ther day rolls,ham.cheese as well as cereal and cakes lovely coffee and a choice of fruit juices. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel. 1 minute Walk from Termini Metro.”
Reviews.Author: BRS1222
Reviews.Content: Booked as secret hotel; Last Minute.com. Paid half advertised cost - around £250.00 for 4 nights. Clean & Comfortable Hotel. Helpful & Attentive Staff. Healthy Options lacking at breakfast. Fruit non existent. Ask for yoghurt; they produce it if requested; perhaps they lock it in hotel safe! Fruit juice was made from powdery sugar; we took our own water to breakfast to save our tooth enamel. Ideal base for exploring all rome has to offer. We had a great time and would re-visit and use the hotel again. A tip is not to take the terravision coach service from ciampino; these are clapped out old coaches with no air con. If you remember the advert 'don't leave dogs in hot cars' you will get the picture. Take the metro (air conditioned) to Anagni and then a 2 minute bus ride to ciampino Airport. It's faster and far more comfortable and it's what the locals do!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location - great service - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Atmo1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 6 months ago via the secret deals on lastminute.com and the first thing I did was come here and check the reviews. At that time they were all really negative and I was really concerned that I'd just wasted a lot of money. Arriving at Termini Station in Rome should have been exciting but I was dreading getting to the hotel. How wrong those previous reviews were. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff on reception were very very helpful, the room was great with a marble bathroom and it was close to everything we needed. The only point I would agree with in the negative posts was this hotel isn't really 4*, but could be classed as a good 3*. When I go back to Rome I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Train Station/Metro”
Reviews.Author: NJExplorers
Reviews.Content: Would rate hotel 3 or 2 star- nice staff, small room, fairly updated/old bld. If you are planning on walking to all of the top sites of Rome this hotel is too far. Overall, it was a reasonable stay for the price; however, beds were not comfortable at all, bathroom shower leaked onto the floor and the water pressure was not great, breakfast was ok and sounds travel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: noblewelshgirl
Reviews.Content: After booking this trip as a suprise birthday present I read a few reviews that were not pleasant about this hotel. I was a little worried, especially as it was a surprise. However I could not fault anything. The service was exellent, the room was spacious and very clean. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have slept in a hotel. The location is great as long as you dont mind walking, if you do the metro is just around the corner so you can hop on and go anywhere all day for 4 euro. The only side that wasnt great was the breakfast, it was ok but nothing to write home about, but there was plenty of choice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: Londonstarter
Reviews.Content: What a great choice. I travelled with a friend and both of our rooms were lovely. The hotel was very clean which had been one of our main worries. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and the breakfast room gave good views of the surrounding area. The hotel is a 3 min walk from Termini Stn and easy to find. The roads aroundTermini, like many main stations, was a little unkempt but still not worrying at all. There are restaurants near the hotel which serve good food if you have had a long day walking. The walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi etc is about 20 mins, but the metro is only 3 mins if you do not want to walk. Metro to Vatican also at Termini. Room service good, all in all for the price of £50 per night was ideal. Cant wait to go back to Rome was wonderful. If you swamped with looking at the different hotels from reviews etc as we were, dont worry this is a good quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One word: "Meh"”
Reviews.Author: natalievi
Reviews.Content: This definitely isn't a 4-star hotel. I would bump it down to a 3-star, or even a 2-star if you factor in the front desk staff. I have no serious complaints, the hotel room was clean and the location was easy since it was right next to the subway at Termini. The one thing that prompted me to write a review was the front desk staff. They are very, very rude!

Reviews.Title: “thats amore”
Reviews.Author: waxiebabe
Reviews.Content: very clean hotel. only one problem it is right on the main road close to the main terminis for buses and trains. very noisy!!!! staff were very helpful and courteous, central to most of the sites around rome

Reviews.Title: “certainly not 4 star but adequate”
Reviews.Author: jimmydog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome and a 2 night stay at the Champagne Palce. I was dreading going to the hotel after reading reviews on the web-site, but to be honest when we got there we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is not a 4 star by british standards, but the room and bed was clean, the pillow cases and towels changed every day. The down side was - the room was quite small, but lets face it in Rome you should not be spending hours in your hotel, and the shower was just ok but tiny. Breakfast was served on the 7th floor (good views) on what was like tressel tables - no cloths on the table and you got a typical Italian breakfast. The plus side it was near the station - train and bus, and you could always get a bus back to the bus station in the evening. I was nervous about staying near a train station but we felt it was an advantage and we never felt threatened - even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Bubblewrap09
Reviews.Content: I would disagree with the bad reviews. The hotel is probably not what you'd expect of 4 star accommodation but it is most acceptable. It's very handy for Termini Station. The staff we encountered were very pleasant. Although the room could be described as faded elegance it was clean and spacious. The shower was however tiny. Very difficult to turn around or indeed lift your arms to wash your hair. Breakfast was acceptable by continental standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: L4R4
Reviews.Content: Great little place. Described as 4 star - not by UK standards but perfect for a long weekend in Rome. Cleaned daily with nice marble bathroom and great powershower. Also perfectly situated about a 10 minute walk from the Colleseum & 15 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. Termini station (main train station in Rome) is literally a one minute walk away too. Breakfast a bit basic but there are so many restaurants and cafes around that it doesn't matter. Prices to book on their website are pretty steep but online travel sites like lastminute.com do the package deal at an excellent rate. Would highly recommend for first time visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: megamushroom
Reviews.Content: Booked through last minute.com as top secret 4 start hotel, 160pound for buy 2 get 1 night free. This rate include a buffet breakfast. You don't expect much for the breakfast, all same in the 3 days stay. 2 different kind of hams, chesse, cereals, non stop coffee, juice, bread. This hotel is within walking distance from Rome Terminal Station. If you get out from the Terminal, on the right side street, 2 streets down, the hotel is there. Just 5 minutes walk I think. The location is excellent. Right below, there is a supermarket, and you can get water, snacks, beer, wine etc. Room itself is okay. We stayed at 509 with a large window overseeing the hotel opposite. Bathroom was a little run down. The shower curtain was unable to close tightly because the rubber along the curtain poped up, nevermind, turn around and make sure water won't spilt out to the floor. Tiolet roll was rusty and the maid was putting the tiolet paper on the spare roll. No wifi, internet connection in room. Only a small 14 inch TV and a fridge. A small writting table. The most funny thing in the only lift of this hotel, where it can only accomodate 4 people at a time. I just in doubt, does it include luggage? I dare to try. The lift is on the lobby floor, not on the street level. Be preapred to lift for a floor on stairs.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolShabba
Reviews.Content: i and my wife have just spent 3 lovely days and nights in the "Eternal City". the Hotel was a concern of mine before we left, due to the bad reviews on this and other sites. After taking the Terrevision transfer from the Airport we walked 5 minutes to the hotel. on arrival at 10.45 am we were given our room (404) and some useful info from the desk clerk. we found the staff to be helpful and pleasent. Also the hotel was clean and tidy and the room we had which was a superior room was spacious and comfortable. the breakfast was pretty basic but enough to put you on untill midday. the surrounding area was not the most pleasant but not once did i or my wife feel unsafe. the locality to Termini station is perfect for getting about on the metro. the decision you have is to choose between lovely hotel in great location but not so pleasant surroundings, or are you very bothered what is out side your window

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel - but much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ajwhitehead
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute.com as a secret hotel, we were slightly concerned to read some of the negative reviews after booking. On arrival therefore we were pleasantly surprised. The Champagne Palce is certainly not a 4* hotel; but if it advertised itself as a 3* then it would be worthy of a 4/5 overall rating. Our 4th floor double room was small (usual for city cenres) but clean, and serviced daily. Bathroom was clean and shower excellent. Reception service was polite and helpful, advising on transport and holding our cases for the day after check-out. Breakfast was limited but just about adequate. Only minor niggles were that the hotel bar isn't generally open, and that the TV only provides Italian stations. The hotel is located about halfway between Termini station and the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore - about 3 mins walk from either; and whilst the area isn't particularly polished, it's certainly not as disagreeable as some of the reviews make out. Quick access to the trains, metro and buses makes travel to and from the airport and within the city easy, hence you don't need to spend much time in the area anyway. Overall I would recommend as long as you go expecting a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeachersonHoliday
Reviews.Content: We picked up this hotel as a "Mystery Hotel" from a well known internet holday company at an excellent price (£150 for three nights for the both of us) and after reading the recent reports were a little apprehensive to say the least but the hotel was fantastic. Check in was quick and easy and the gentleman behind the counter most helpful. We had a room on the 5th floor which was spotless,nice big bed and the usual fixtures and fittings. The minibar didnt have much in it, but that isnt a major issue for us. Lovely marble bathroom with one of the best showers I've ever had at a hotel, it was so powerful and hot! Breakfast was typical European effort with bread, cheese, meat and cereals - not much to write home about but did the job before a days walk around Rome. A good location, 15 mins stroll from the Colliseum and 5mins from the main station, although apparently not in the nicest of areas, we felt safe and there are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. I would definately go back, not sure why all the other reviews slate this place. Its a little dated and probably not a true 4 star, but it is clean, well run and in a great location. Great Value for money - go there.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ASYAmanda
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: It is far away from the center of Rome but is close to the train station. The area near by does have some café’s and restaurants but nothing terribly impressive. DURRATION/TIME OF STAY: We were only staying over night thank god! July 2008. HOTEL: First I would like to say that we were with a tour guide who made the reservations. The hotel was old and not safe at all. I feel that the pictures of the hotel on their website are very deceiving. I stayed in a room on the 6th floor that looked like an attic room. It was very small poorly lit and dingy. The window was very small and the TV did not work. We had no mini bar, no air-conditioning and no amenities. The bathroom was also not very clean and the “shower” (nothing more than a plastic insert) leaked. My friend who was staying on a lower level was staying in a room that was equally dingy but was much larger and had a large window. The lobby was okay, but there were no bellmen to help with bags and we had to haul our luggage up 10 very steep stairs to get to the front door. The elevator was very old, slow and malfunctioned several times while we were there. To make matters worse, one gentleman in our group was locked in his bathroom all night long. He pounded on the door for hours but no one heard him (he was the only one staying on that floor apparently). It wasn’t until the next morning when we were all leaving that someone noticed his absence and went to check on him that he was let out. Thank goodness there wasn’t a fire or an emergency! I felt so sorry for his situation. The hotel didn’t even say sorry just said they would “fix it” which I doubt they will do considering all the other broken items in the hotel. SERVICE: Poor. Check in was easy but the staff was surly. No bellmen. No room or laundry service. INTERNET: None. RESTAURANT/IN ROOM DINING: They serve breakfast on the top floor which had nice views but was very sparse. SECURITY: There was no safe in my room. No doormen to watch who came in and out of the hotel and of course the faulty door. The building also creaked horribly and I would doubt it would pass a safety test. OVERALL: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! It goes beyond not being comfortable; it is a big safety hazard. Don’t let the 4 star rating fool you. Our tour guide said that the rating system in all of Italy is not on a uniform scale and it is very hard (especially with older hotels) to tell if a rating is true or not. It is run down, not safe and not comfortable. If I could give this hotel no stars I would!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: QQ-LITTLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in August last year and got it in a deal - 3nights paid for 2. worked out just over 200 quid. Given it is a 4 star hotel I would have expected much better than that. the barthroom is tiny,when you stand in the shower you feel like you are nearly touching all the wall. I am a person who doesnt care much about facilities or stars but I do want a clean bathroom and bed. My experience with the bathroom in this hotel is horrible. the carpet in our room is dark colour and looks really dirty - I would not allow my boyfriend walking on his bare feet basically. Also the room we stay in has window towards another residential building block and very close, if you open the window other people can see you clearly in the room so had to close the window all the time. Breadfast is ok, nothing to shine out. The location is convenient but a street not far away is full of doggie internet cafes and pretty much looks like a gangster area. This hotel has seriously broken my belif in stars.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable not much else”
Reviews.Author: completerandomer
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps the most basic four star hotel I have ever stayed in - however basic should not be interpreted as bad. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of amenities then this should not be your first choice. However if you are looking for a comfortable base from which to explore Rome then this hotel is perfect. When I first arrived at the hotel I was assigned a room which had a plank of wood lying on the bed and a broken toilet seat. Upon my complaints a very apologetic receptionist assigned me a room on the ground floor. The room was very comfortable with a high standard of fittings and furnishings. The bathroom is again basic but usable - a basic shower unit with a curtain with a power shower - marble basin surface and the standard hotel shampoo and shower gel. As I was busy exploring Rome this hotel was perfect as all I wanted was somewhere to return to to sleep. However if I had wanted more I would have been very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Hugoviz
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found the reception staff very helpful, were advised which room but when we got there it was not ready so, we were put into a different room - great this one had a balcony. The room was basic, the fridge got our water cold, the shower was hanging off the wall and tied up with string -not very helpful as my daughter in law in only 4' 10". We were astonished that a 4* hotel did not have anything in the fridge other than 1 coke and 1 bottle of water and the room was devoid of any tea/coffee facilities. We asked for coffee and tea to be delivered to the room and were told this was not possible. So we spent little time in the hotel except for sleeping and breakfast (nvg). However on the day we were leaving we found a Gaggia machine in the Reception area and Bar upstairs. They had obviously closed down most of their facilities and staff was at a minimum. OUR ADVICE IS DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL AFTER MID OCTOBER! IT IS DEFINITELY NOT 4 STAR!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome from”
Reviews.Author: Gobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Great base, we flew into Ciampino Airport from Liverpool John Lennon Airport, England, UK and got the terravision bus (others are available!) to the Termini railway station in Rome (or Roma as the locals say!). It is a 4 minute walk to the Champagne Palace Hotel from the Termini - so do not get a taxi, unless you need to. Its a level street walk - no steep pavements, and passes several local shops enroute that are useful for food, general shopping, tabbachi for postcard stamps. This hotel was probably very much a 4 star hotel some years ago, elegant marble flooring and traditional high quality italian decor and flare(1980's?). It still looks nice if a little tired here & there. We thought it more of a 3.5 star, however the attentive if slightly reserved staff were very helpful, providing a map and guide, and offered local day & night tours. Room (on the 4th floor) was very clean & tidy. Small TV with mainly italian channels and BBC World and SKY movie channel 3 with english programmes - it was OK for us between sightseeing adventures, dressing table and goodsized mirror, small wardrobe, cloak area, mini bar fridge, good firm bed - very comfortable, full sized mirror,. The bathroom - marble surfaces, toilet, beeday (?), and shower (don't pull the cord its for emergency!). Hot water allday, rooms cleaned and fresh towels (large & small), well made bed and fresh linen where needed each day! We took a travel kettle as we got there midday and wanted a 'brew'. Breakfast included in our deal (from Lastminute dot com), all you can eat fresh continental fare, hot & cold beverges, again helpful staff - they let us breakfast a little earlier than the 7am - 9.30 am times, as we had an early flight. The breakfast room on 7th floor (lift or stairs to this level from the lobby or room levels)boas wonderful aerial /rooftop views - its a little too much areials 7 rooftops, but some monuments and historical buildings can be seen to get your bearing (take a map to breakfast!!). All in,we would go back again. Saw lots more "4*" hotels nearby and thought the Champagne palace was a better one. Enjoy, Roma is a wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rafasanty
Reviews.Content: I was really scared when I read the reviews about this hotel but I had already booked so decided to take the risk. All I can tell you is that me and my girlfriend had a nice week in Rome and in a way thanks to the hotel.The room and the bathroom are very nice and clean. Everyday when we returned they had already cleaned the room, changed the towels,etc... You have a nice view when you have breakfast at the last floor over Santa Maria Maggiore a very beautiful church which is at 1 minute walking from the hotel. The hotel is near the railwaystation Termini and at 20 minutes walking from the main sites. The staff was very efficient and nice.The last day we could even left our luggage till late at the hotel so we didn't have to pay for the luggage lockers at the railway station! I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: phrodo
Reviews.Content: Allthough the rooms are on the small side, I dont really get all the bad reviews. The staff was friendly and helpful, the cleaning impeccable and the location - well it must be among the best in Rome. A fun walk to the Spanish steps, 300 yards from the Santa Maria Maggiore Cathedral and about the same from Termini. Lots of cool little trattorias and cafes nearby. The breakfast is everything you can expect in Italy - theres nobody there fo fry up your omelette or crisp your bacon, but nice bread, cereals, milk and jams - and plenty of places for American breakfasts nearby for those who need a 500 calory start

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base”
Reviews.Author: Gibbo1962
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews of this hotel and was a bit apprehensive about staying but as it was already booked didn't have much choice. Was pleasantly surprised when I arrived and all I can say to the negative reviews is GET A LIFE and get out more. Yes the rooms and bathrooms are on the small size but how much time do you spend in your room when you're visiting Rome. The train station is literally 2 minutes walk away so access to the rest of the city is easy. There are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance and we never experienced any problems being out in the evenings. All in all not what I'd class as 4 star but also ok for what you pay. If you're expecting the Savoy don't go here otherwise give it a go and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “never a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: cass1410
Reviews.Content: Chose the Champagne Palace based on the location and the fact that it looked a reasonable 4 star hotel. The location is good, although on arrival at Termini it was hailing, thundering and lightening so we got a taxi - 20 euros later we realised how close we were and that we had been robbed! Initial thoughts of the hotel were it was small. We were advised our room was 408. There was no air con as the unit was hanging off the wall, the bathroom lights were hanging out, no hairdryer, plug sockets hanging out the wall, the minibar shelves were broken and there was an open bottle of water and one coke in there. We also went to open the window and the handle fell off!! We advised reception then went out for a few hours. On return nothing had been done so we asked to move rooms. Reception advised they needed to check with the manager?? Eventually we were shown a nice room on the ground floor which is actually one that is used as the picture for rooms - still not 4* standard but at least this wasnt a health hazard. The hotel itself was poor. We only went for one night and thought that a 4 * would give us a bit of luxury - Would not recommend this at all.

Reviews.Title: “not worth even 1 star”
Reviews.Author: sylbou
Reviews.Content: hello, I have to say that the hotel is well placed. the only advantage as all the rest is a catastrophy. first surprise, it is wrtitten in big letters in the room that the guest must leave at 10 am. yes, yes....check out at 10 AM. I HAVE NEVER SEEN THIS IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. The tv is from the seventies and most channels are not well adjusted the shower has got leakage. you have one towel, one soap...etc so do not think about taking 2 or 3 showers albeit outside temperature is 35 degree celsuis during the day so you just sweating all day and you have to take another with the same humid towel. the breakfast is so good that you would like to puke. there is no insulation so you get to hear all what your neighboors are doing, if you want to sleep it is a nightmare. etc etc etc etc I paid 140 euro and really it is a big hustle.

Reviews.Title: “Harshly rated but DO NOT TURN LEFT OUT OF THE HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: lucyd6
Reviews.Content: Before staying at this hotel my partner and I read some reviews about it and were frankly dreading staying there but decided to be open minded about the situation and judge it for ourselves. We arrived at the hotel and were VERY pleasantly surprised. the hotel has a nice entrance and the staff were very friendly and helpful. we were shown to a room which was very small but the door did not shut so we rang reception and they changed our room straight away with no problems. We then moved to another room which was again very small but although the rooms are small they are nicely furnished and they are VERY clean. The sheets were changed everyday and the room was given a thorough clean daily. The breakfast was ample and in my opinion the choice that was given was plenty. I would definately stay at this hotel again. I would however give everyone wishing to stay here a couple of words of advice. When you leave the hotel to go sightseeing (the hotel is in an excellent location for this) DO NOT TURN LEFT OUT OF THE HOTEL!! YOU WILL SERIOUSLY REGRET IT! If you turn left out of the hotel you immediately walk into what me and my partner called 'THE GHETTO!' Its horrible! we turned left out of the hotel the first day we were there and it set a horrible tone for the rest of the holiday and we frankly wanted to leave. the next day we turned right out of the hotel and were pleasantly surprised. Although it is not the upmarket part of rome, it was a lot safer than turning left! The hotel should not be rated as 4* (i would put it at the high end of 3*) but if you are looking for somewhere to stay which is clean, and very handy for the sights then stay in this hotel. I didn't have any bad experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too much noise”
Reviews.Author: boozercow
Reviews.Content: We arrived late ish and was greeted with very friendly staff. The rooms are small, typically European, with a nice bathroom. The bed was comfortable and large and the room was clean. The room had air-conditioning but it was quite loud. We found that the room did keep quite cool at night without the air-con. The location we found, very convenient as it is very easy to get anywhere in Rome from the train station area. The breakfast was the typical continental European, coffee, pastries and bread and meats, simple but very nice. The breakfast room was on the top floor and the view was really very pleasant. When we had any questions on where to eat or where things are the staff very really very helpful. So in short a great place to stay, if it had not been so noisy! Every night at about 5am it sounded like a train ran through the hotel we came to the conclusion that it was the cleaners moving a trolley or something, but that let it down really. We did not complain because we only stayed there for 3 nights, but if we had done any longer, we would have because it would wake you up. This is a real shame because other than that we felt the hotel was pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrible hotel by all standards. I will not give it any star rating.”
Reviews.Author: i_okorji
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK if you don't mind a dusty room which was never cleaned for the 8 nights of stay but one (after shouting loud). You should remember to bring your bed linen along ( Blankets, duvet-cover and some sheets). Air ducts are all blocked and so what you have is circulation of stale air and dust in the room. Keep your window open, then comes the noise from the traffic. I was lucky to be on the 6th floor after experiencing a third floor accommodation. Inclusive breakfast buffet: that's a joke. Just consider the breakfast as an opportunity to leave your room and be rewarded with a fine view of Rome. You may take advantage of the lounge on the 7th floor ( Bring your wine along. No bar service). Reception Staff: Excellent. Location: Excellent Will I ever stay in this hotel? Perhaps, but I'll equip myself with a hoover and duster to clean the room and toilet, bed linen, and be prepared to take down the window curtains for cleaning. I will not bother with the so called breakfast. I will insist staying on the 5/6th floor and in a twin bedroom (not double) if I'm traveling with my wife, turn off the air conditioning unit and use natural ventilation otherwise bring along some dust masks. Yes, I may stay in the hotel in the future with the precautions in mind if I can not find anything better in Rome. Choice of decent Italian restaurants in Rome are not that many but here is one you may try: Ristorante Scoglio di Fristo, Via Merulana, No 256 tel : 064872765, 064873115. (Close to Santa Maria Maggiore, and about 10 min walk from the Termini station. I discovered this restaurant by share coincidence, a day before my departure (unfortunately).

Reviews.Title: “keep this brand of champagne on ice”
Reviews.Author: fidelma
Reviews.Content: This supposedly four star outfit is in the much-maligned Termini district, around five minutes on shanks’ mare to Italy’s main railway station. Although this locality is the gaff’s main calling card, rooms are nicely laid out at the Palace with comfy bedding and some very upscale furniture. However, it is out of proportion to the general size and you might actually find yourself with more room to manoeuvre in the bathroom. Generally this space was quite attractive to behold but both w.c and shower unit seemed a tad flimsy, needful of some very careful handling. Living space is well ventilated and quiet with the windows shut. There’s also a safety deposit box in the wardrobe and a fridge .All the same, it is a little lacking in such niceties as extra coat hangers and kosher looking room keys. These were plain white credit-card style with not especially professional handwritten labels which were apt to fall off. Of that ever handy Do Not Disturb/ Please Clean Room tag there was no sign. Moreover, it was not unusual to come back to quarters vacated at 7.30 am at 3.30pm and find them untouched by the chambermaid. The building has a quite ritzy foyer area with marble stairway but it’s terribly steep with no banisters. Another minus point mobility -wise is the fact that this seven floor building has but one extremely cranky lift that is apt to give up the ghost if more than four people jump in. It did seem staff generally were rather overstretched. At Reception, there was some strain in the lingo department, compounded with a cavalier approach to problem solving. That’s definitely a factor to keep in mind if you run into difficulty with access to your safety deposit box. During my stay this did seem to be an issue for many guests. There is a dearth of four star customer service skills in an environment where a 10 euro service charge applies to sorting the matter out. A rooftop garden and operational bar area -advertised online- were incidentally no where to be found .However, there are a number of excellent –and delightfully unpretentious- restaurants in the neighbourhood; the trattoria directly across the road is deservedly popular with guests. The Coliseum is around twenty minutes walk and Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore is nearby. As well as the exquisite Basilica, you’ll find there a handy complex of Upim chain store, underground supermarket and a cafeteria where a decent cup of joe is to be found at all hours. That’s a result frankly, as breakfast is not the Champagne Palace’s strong suit. Juices (selection of two-wow!) were like water and coffee (from a machine) like tar. The freshness of the limited fare was questionable and any guest who fancied something as luxurious as say, yoghurt would have been up a gum tree. In addition, crockery was apt to be chipped and key cutlery items were not always available as and when required. All in, I’d be keen to stay in this super-central area of the Eternal City again .Its proximity to Termini can hardly be topped plus the 45 minute link between there and Fiumincino Airport is a great boon. However, I think I’ll be checking into the more promising Albergo Meditteraneo in nearby via Cavour-what a foyer!-and urging fellow Rome lovers to swerve a pricey option that’s very far from palatial.

Reviews.Title: “10 sqm rooms in this 4* hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bublina
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Hotel Champagne Palace is situated near the Termini Station. This area is not very nice (I decided to call it roman Bronx) -occupied by Pakistanians and Africans. On the other hand, it is a good starting position for most of the trips. ROOM: I was very disappointed with the size of the room (not more than 10 sqm). After opening the door, there was only bed, one closet and a bed table with one chair. Nothing else would fit. We even had problems with opening our suitcase. BATHROOM: 1m wide x 3,5 m long... with shower on one side and basin on the other. Door opened inside the bathroom, so when I brushed my teeth and my boyfriend tired to enter, I got slammed with the door. BREAKFAST: Every single day the same poor variety of food to choose from: breadrolls, bread, 2 sorts of ham (same ones every day), cheese, butter, jam, nuttella, cornflakes, croissant, cake and pie. They also have yogurt, but you need to ask for it. Possitive thing was breakfast room on the top floor of the hotel with a nice view. STAFF: OK, but... - cleaning lady came into our room at 8 am without knocking - reciptionist: when I asked for a plate, I did not get one. Also there was a problem with getting a bottle opener (receptionist did not have have someone bring it to my room, but told me I had to get down to the reception later. Would I recognize this hotel? ...no, this hotel definitely does not deserve 4 stars. It was a waste of money (I woud evaluate it as a OK 2* hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Champagne causes headaches”
Reviews.Author: enquiringcameragirl
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisors - do not be fooled by the name. This ain't no shangri-la for your Roman Holiday. This is not what discerning travellers would call a four star hotel! Instead there are a number of very specific problems with this hotel that you should be made aware of before parting with the considerable sum of money you'd need to stay here. A lift which can only accommodate four people is not sufficient for a hotel which has seven floors. It frequently broke down, leaving elderly guests to fend for themselves. A buffet breakfast was of quite the poorest quality I have ever witnessed and certainly not befitting of a four star hotel. Staff who were plainly running late were surly when people turned up at the official opening time and dished out chipped plates and glassware. Hot drinks were like dishwater. I am not satisfied that the fare was fresh and was served up with such bad grace, I ultimately chose to breakfast outwith the hotel. And there is NO coffee shop or bar within the hotel, contrary to publicity material on every online site I read. The maid service was woefully slow – it was the norm for a room to lie unattended to until well after 3pm. Why does a four star hotel consider this acceptable? Safes malfunctioned all over the hotel with great frequency, proving impossible to open. Desperate guests were forced to contact reception who then charged them 10 Euro for the privilege of having these opened with a key. Tripadvisors - be aware that that staff stated that they could not be held responsible for items that went missing from the safe! Have you ever heard anything like it? The staff's attitude to problem solving leaves a lot to be desired - here is a good example. I had a specific problem with my WC which needed attended to. I complained twice and was assured a plumber would visit the room and if the problem could not be fixed I would be moved to another room On returning to my room after a day trip, the situation had worsened. It quickly became clear to me that contrary to what I had been told, no-one had been near the room. When I challenged the receptionist, he admitted that he had lied to me. The proprietor who is very much worth a watching then told me that she was unable to move me because the hotel was full. After a heated discussion, I was eventually moved. The scenario I described could so easily have been avoided and represents a level of hassle I do not care to deal with on holiday. We have a case here where problems are not dealt with and guests are being lied to. And the same guests are paying over £100 a night! I have been visiting Italy for more than two decades. This is without doubt THE worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. Tripadvisors - you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug017
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on several different web sites about this hotel, I was apprehensive about staying at this hotel (which was recommended by my travel agent). My group of 25 stayed there 2 weeks ago. What you need to remember is that you are staying in European hotels - not a U.S. chain of hotels. I've been to Europe in the summer, and air conditioning in Europe isn't what it is in the U.S. I vowed I'd never go back to Europe in the summer after that trip - only when it was cooler, which is why I opted for a spring trip. This hotel was clean, breakfast was good and the staff was friendly. The only drawback, if you will, was that there was a flight of marble steps going up into the hotel, and a very small elevator that only holds 4 people (without luggage). It was close to restaurants and shops, and 2 block from the train station, so we were able to get around very easily. I felt safe walking around at night, too. The rooms were small - like that you'd get on a cruise, but we didn't spend much time in the room - too much to see and do in Rome! The only drawback was that we had luke warm to cold water in our room, and no hot showers, but that was only one room - the others in my group all had warm or hot water. If you don't want European charm then stay at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scouse_Southport
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews below this one you'd think you were staying in Beirut but no the Hotel turns out to be a rather elegant little place within very easy walk of all the main tourist attractions and in close proximity to Termini Station were both trains and busses can be found which will get you to anywhere. We had nice clean rooms, hot water, lockable doors. The TV was fine - there were English channels - BBC World, Sky Cinema 3, CNN and about 25 other channels to choose from if we so wished. All with excellent reception. But hey, we never went there to watch TV, we wanted to see the sights. Breakfast was fine, in a rooftop restaurant with a fine view of the city. Adjacent to the restaurant is a bar and lounge area, also with excellent views. All in all a very pleasurable experience. The staff were always smiling and courteous - we never had a problem getting a taxi, simply ask the desk clerk and he or she will ring one for you and it will be outside the door the moment you step out of the door. The room was fairly small but this is typical of European rooms but they weren't cramped and there was plenty of room to walk around. There is a fridge but no kettle but with so many cafe's and bars around it wasn't really missed. Each day we came back to the room about 6.00pm to find that the maid had been in and straightened or changed the bedclothes and put new towels in the bathroom. There was plenty of bathroom accessories including a hairdryer, shampoo and showergel sachets as well as blocks of soap. You will be told that the area at night is one to avoid, but the hotel is on the corner of a very busy street with lots of shops and bars and restaurants very close by and at no time did we feel threatened or unsafe. as long as you are careful and stick to the well lit main roads you will be okay but then that could be said about any city at night. All in all a very pleasent hotel, situated in quite a busy built up area - yes it is noisy but the windows when shut, block it all out. I would heartily recommend it to anybody who is looking to visit Rome and does not want to stay in too expensive a hotel. We had a fabulous time and part of that is down to how much we enjoyed staying there. I would have no hesitations staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: Sarah39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and wondered what all the fuss was about. We booked the hotel for 2 reasons: price and proximity to the major attractions in Rome. We weren't expecting luxury, after all, you get what you pay for. All we wanted was somewhere close to the sights (we got that) and somewhere clean and comfortable (we got that too). The breakfast was good, eat as much as you want. The front desk staff were very polite and helpful, even phoning for taxis for us when we wanted to go out for the night. We were impressed. At the end of the day, when you're on holiday, you only need a room to sleep in. If you want to spend all day in your room, you should pay top prices for luxury. We overlooked the main road and yes, it was noisy, street cleaners, trams etc all passing at 4am, but you deal with it. We wanted central and that's what we got (and the noise and traffic that go with it). We would definitely stay again at the Champagne Palace and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “well placed”
Reviews.Author: HappyCotswolds
Reviews.Content: Very close to Train station-walkable within 3 mins.. Central to all tourist attractions, all within walking distance. Hotel basic, but had no problem with room or cleanliness of Hotel, and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible dont go!”
Reviews.Author: burke231180
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and the room was nothing like the photos made out. The room was approximately 3m x 3m and the floor and surfaces absolutely filthy. The television was foriegn and so no english satalite tv. The floor of the whole room flooded when the crap shower was used. The mini bar had a bottle of water and a can of coke and nothing else. The hairdrier was useless and in addition there was no tea or coffee making facilities. The walls were so thin you could hear all the traffic adjacent and everyone else in the hotel, therefore got no sleep in 3 nights. They make you pay up front before you see the room and so you are so annoyed when you see your room because they wont return your money. The breakfast buffet consists of tea or coffee and to eat you can have egg or toast with cheese or ham. The staff are not at all helpful and are so so rude. It would struggle to get 2 stars never mind 4 star ! Please do not go at all, we enquired into other 4 star hotels while we were there and you can get so much more for less money and we know because we asked to see the rooms and we wish we had booked various other hotels before Champagne Palace. Do not go the place is a disgusting hostel nevermind a hotel. I read other reviews before booking the hotel and i thought "well the photos and things look ok so maybe they have refurbished the hotel" Well they really havent, its horrid do not go to this hotel please!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Horrible Hotel!!! Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: craazylisa13
Reviews.Content: This is such a bad hotel Words really cannot describe. Awfully rude staff, nasty breakfast, tiny rooms with no ventilation and walls are as thin as paper. I could hear my neighbor sneezing!!!!! The water issue is ridiculous! I read some previous posts and cannot believe the same thing has been happening for over a year there. Hot water would have been nice, but ANY water would have been better! We stayed for three nights and the water would turn off unexpectantly all hours of the day. When we called the front desk we were given the same excuse each and every time..."it is being fixed". My mother-in-law had to use the mineral water from the mini bar to get the shampoo out of her hair when the water went off mid-shower, only for them to try to charge us for it!!! The best was when I used the bathroom in my room and could not flush the toilet for three hours!!! Imagine the smell of the timy room after that. DONT GO!!!! IT IS HORENDOUS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: Varzanel
Reviews.Content: Worst Experience Me and my wife stayed in this hotel for three nights from 20 th of October. Those were the worst days of our holiday in Rome. The hotel rooms are very small (for example 3X3m – the room we stayed in), and the open bathroom door covered all the sink and mirror. Cold water, horrible food (poor quality and variety). The cherry from the cake came in our last day in this hotel. My laptop, a mobile phone and a new perfume was stolen from our hotel room. My laptop and the phone from the suitcase (in that day I forgot to lock the suitcase). The hotel personnel wouldn’t help us in any way; they didn’t want to call the police and not even to support us. I have to search the police station in order to get a police report. You can find posted on the picture section copy the police report stating clear the theft from our hotel room. If you want to have a nice holiday in Rome please do not book this hotel. The personnel are rude and barely speak English. Overall I would rate this hotel for one star maybe. Oh, I forgot to tell you that the area in which the hotel is located (Termini Station) is a dangerous area with all kind of junkies (mostly gypsies).

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jslowboat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite convenient to the main train terminal, lots of shopping, and the Coliseum wasn't that far of a walk. The hotel was merely adequate, yet the desk clerks were friendly, just didn't go out of their way to accomdate us in any way. It's no frills . We were part of a group so I don't know how the rates compare.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: Ace4294
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July. On the plus side, it is very close to the train station so it is easy to only haul your bags a block or two when arriving or departing, the room was small but clean and the staff was helpful with directions and information. On the negative side, it was rather expensive for what you get. We paid 120 euro/night. Also, the area around the hotel is not the greatest, it's far from typical Rome attractions if you don't want to take the metro and the room is really small...even by european standards. I might stay here again but I think I would check out some other locations first. If you are just looking for a place close to the station and don't care about the price then it's probably ok for you. This was the most expensive place we stayed at throughout our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - very bad experiencia”
Reviews.Author: Magú
Reviews.Content: terrible hotel, the water of the shower was cold/warm like a Scotish shower (PROBLEM KNOWS BY MANAGMENT...). Staff was incompetent... it s not a 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Be carefully !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RifaStar
Reviews.Content: Do you feel lucky - if not stay away from this hotel. You pay up-fron at check-in. Small and smelly rooms. The staff are incompetence. The breakfast is terrible. It's NOT a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREME BUDJET!!!”
Reviews.Author: parisqueen04
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to see Rome and finally got the chance but I would only recommend this hotel if you are on an EXTREME budjet! My room was clean and very small (which rooms aren't in europe)to the point you had to jump over my luggage to get to the bathroom. There is no tub but only a very akward shower stall. I don't know if the hotel had a problem with their plumbing or not but I had to take a very quick shower as the water was starting to back up. The area is not bad in the morning but I don't recommend going out at night. The train station is a couple of blocks away where you can catch a hop on/hop off tour bus which by the way is an excellant way to see this ancient city. The property offers a cold buffet breakfast which consist of cereal,pastries,poach eggs,sandwiches,juice and coffee.Keep in mind what is considered continental breakfast in the states does not have to apply to other countries. As for the staff they can be unpleasant. If you are on an EXTREME budjet and REALLY want to see Rome than take a chance on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cecebe
Reviews.Content: We had some trepidation about staying at the Champagne Palace based on the reviews we read before departing on our trip. I wanted to be certain to post because our experience was really quite good. The hotel is located near the Termini. We stayed four nights. We used public transportation exclusively (the Termini is a great location for public transit)- or walked to our destinations and back. The first night we walked back through the city around 1am, the second we got off our bus and walked to the hotel at about 12:20am, in fact we came back to the hotel late every night. We live in a city in the states so are accustomed to city life and were not overly concerned about walking through the area...we also used basic good urban sense and walked with purpose and didn't dawdle. The staff was very helpful, friendly and patient - we do not speak Italian...and they accomodated us with very good English. The breakfast buffet was ok...convenient and very similar to others we encountered in European cities. If you prefer you can always head out to a local coffee bar or cafe. We had no problem with our room. Shower worked. We brushed our teeth with the tap water. Our safe didn't work...but we were able to use the hotel's safe. Altogether it was really a very good value...and quite comfortable. It's not the Ritz, but you're not paying for the Ritz. If we got the hotel for the same price, we would stay there again without hesitation...and spend our money on the great food in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family recently and we were all pleasantly surprised. I have stayed at some real dives in Rome and this hotel went above and beyond my expectations. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and the location was perfect. We were able to walk out the door and be only a short distance from many of the major sights in Rome. This hotel is truly a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: pudra
Reviews.Content: i have stayed there for 3 nights 7-9 January 06. Just a one word to describe: disaster..!! My room number was 105. All of the rooms that are on the first floor has no carpet. Plus our room has no tv, no shower and no proper air ventilation in our toilet. We have to live together with that unbearable smell that come through our wc. Hotel's location was good. Near to Termini and other historic places. When you walk arround you have chance to see other hotels that carries 4 stars like Champagne Palace. So, you can easily compare them. I think head of Italian tourism board who gave out those stars was drunk when he gave 4 star to this hotel. Same Asian guy do the housekeeping, luggage handling and breakfast things within the same suits. So, please check the rates of other 4 stars also i reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you need to shower”
Reviews.Author: BostonMADiane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay and the location is not bad. But the water problem is a real deal breaker. I would not stay again because the water was scalding hot. I burned myself trying to wash my face. I will look for another place to stay when I return to Rome. I had to buy bottled water to brush my teeth. Based on the other other reviews I've read on this website - this seems to be a chronic problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed at the hotel on the last week of september 05 for 3 nights. Reading all the reviews we came with no expectations what so ever, and we found it a samll & nice hotel, situated in a great place for 2 train- travellers like us. True, it's quite scary walking in that area neighborhood at night, but we just kept the not- crossing- to- the- left- side of the street- rule (our rule). From the right there are great pizza places ect. The reception guys were VERY nice & ready to help any time we needed. The room itself was CLEAN, though small. During our 3 nights- stay every evening as we came back we found the room clean & organized. We DID NOT had a water- problem, and every night we had enough HOT WATER for a long shower for each one of us. The brakefast was not sensational, but average, as we later found out in our further hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice, stay away.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Champagne Palace in Rome for approximately three days. This was three days too many. We went during the weekend of Bianca Notte and the city was packed. First off, the hotel management did not tell us that the room card key activated the lights in the corridors and in the rooms. Found out the hard way after smacking into a few walls and doors that the door card key had to be inserted into a receptacle near the front door and left in. Next, we found out late at night that hot water was non-existent. Well, the following morning we didn't have to worry about not having hot water to take our showers, but the fact that there was no water at all. Called the front desk and was advised that there was a slight problem and that it would be fixed in five to ten minutes. We already knew it would take more than five to ten minutes to fix this problem. We left on our all day tour excursion and came back in the evening to find out that we finally had water but, yet again, no hot water. Once again we called the front desk to find out why hasn't the problem been fixed and again was told they were working on it and it would take five to ten minutes. Okay, I know how long five or ten minutes is, but they definitely did not. We waited for 90 minutes, giving them the benefit of the doubt, and gave them another call. This time my sister called and asked when might we have water and again was told five to ten minutes. In her next question to the person at the front desk she was hung up on. We finally did take our showers, etc. with cool water and couldn't get out of that hotel fast enough. When checking out of the hotel I asked the front desk why so many problems with the water and why weren't we advised. He acted like he didn't know a thing about it. Oh yeah, on another note, their breakfast lay out is pretty bad too!

Reviews.Title: “Four stars? Not on this planet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rather bizzarly named 'Champagne Palace' during a short break of 5 nights. Having read some reviews after booking, we weren't expecting too much, but thought it might have been reasonable to expect the opportunity to take a shower without having to hold the shower head at all times. Our 16 month baby had a cot with wooden slats which came off during the night, excellent news for any kids hoping too fall out and/or get stuck. Breakfast was as bad as any I've ever came across. Very limited choice with a freshness we could only guess at.
